loans.name: Nelly Kati

texts.es: Nelly tiene 39 años es conviviente con 02 hijos educando hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de menú el cual los expende a los obreros civiles. En las tardes se dedica al cuidado de adultos mayores. Los días sábados prepara polladas chuletadas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres: arroz, aceite papas y carne. La nueva meta a futuro de Nelly es tener un restaurant en donde pueda ofrecer sus menús. Nelly agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Nelly is 39 years old. She is in a common law marriage and is raising 2 children. For 6 years, she has sold meals to public construction workers. In the afternoon, she works caring for the elderly. On Saturdays she makes polladas chuletadas. She will invest the loan in buying food: rice, oil, potatoes and meat. Nelly's new goal for the future is to have a restaurant where she can offer her meals. Nelly is grateful to the KIVA investors for the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, potatoes, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es vendedora de Salón, y está cursando el Ultimo año de la carrera Administración de Empresas. 
Ella pidió este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de Tesis, Cuenta que para ella es un desafío muy grande llevar ambas cosas, es decir estudiar y trabajar, pero el esfuerzo a la larga tiene sus frutos. Desea convertirse en una profesional exitosa, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su conocimiento.
texts.en:
Carmen is from the city of Curuguaty.  She is studying and working at the same time.  She works as a sales person and is in her final year studying business management.

Carmen has asked for this loan in order to cover the costs of her dissertation.  She tells us that working and studying at the same time is a big challenge but, in the long term, it will have its rewards.  Carmen wants to become a successful professional who can help other people through what she has learned.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her dissertation.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 40 años, es una luchadora mujer que a día a día labora para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada a la afueras de la ciudad. Ella, evita hablar de la situación difícil que vivió con el padre de sus hijos. Pero rescata que aprendió a valorarse aún más, por eso es una mujer emprendedora. Comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de cerveza y bebidas gasificadas, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos; además prepara comida para vender en su resiente recreo turístico “La Inolvidable”, asimismo cría decenas de patos y gallinas que enseba para vender y preparar sus potajes, pues le gusta disfrutar de los animales, Daniela, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, por eso el negocio le resulta rentable pues no tiene que pagar a terceras personas, su espíritu emprendedor ahora hace que piense en instalar una granja grande para que pueda vender al por mayor, ya hace poco obtuvo buenas ganancias con la venta de decenas de cuyes que compro a una negociante de la ciudad de Huancayo, orgullosa cuenta “críe 120 gallinas, las hice crecer desde muy tiernas y las comercialicé cada una a 35 soles, por so .estoy segura que este negocio me resultará muy beneficioso”.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Daniela, compra constantemente mercadería para su negocio, por ello con los S/.1000 soles que solicita, comprará los insumos necesarios para que prepare comida, además de cerveza, bebidas gasificadas y algunos dulces
texts.en: Daniela is 40 years old. She is a fighter who works day to day to get her family ahead. She is the single mother of  5 children and lives with 4 of them in her own house located outside of town. She avoids talking about the difficult situation with the father of her children, but she says that she learned to value herself more. That is why she is an enterprising woman. She started to sell beer and sodas in order to get her children ahead. She also prepares meals to sell in her new tourism restaurant “La Inolvidable”. She also raises dozens of chickens and ducks that she fattens up to sell and and to make her stews, because she likes to enjoy her animals. Daniela says that she has her children's help and that is why the business is profitable because she doesn't have to pay third parties. Her enterprising spirit is now making her plan on putting in a bigger barn so she can sell wholesale, since recently she made a good profit selling dozens of guinea pigs that she bought from a merchant in the city of Huancayo. She says proudly “I raised 120 hens from when they were very small and I sold them all at once for 35 soles. That is why I am sure that this business will be beneficial." She belongs to the “Las Brisas” communal bank, and this is her third loan with KIVA. She is happy to be working with her communal bank who are very supportive, kind and responsible people.   Daniela constantly buys merchandise for her business. That is why, with the S/.1000 soles she is asking for she will buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her food, as well as beer, sodas and some sweets.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, para poder salir adelante y poder tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de sacos, cartones y cilindros vacios, el labora en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; Raul cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo porque es muy amable con sus clientes.

Raul está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio  como sacos costales, entre otros , así podrá atender de mejor manera  a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a  sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Raul lives in the city of Chiclayo.  In order to get ahead, and to be able to cover his costs, Raul works in her small business selling bags, boxes and cylinders. He works some ten hours a day and can serve up to fifteen customers each day.  Raul thinks the business is going well because he is very hard working and, above all, because he is very friendly with his customers.

Raul is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to buy more merchandise for this business, such as big bags and more.  With this loan, Raul will be able to serve his customers better and to continue fighting to make his big dream, of giving his daughters a university education, a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bags, rice sacks, and more).

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 36 años, está casada con Josue y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia hecha de madera. Esther se dedica a la venta de diversos insumos para reparación de vehículo y un taller de servicio automotriz. Fue una decisión según comenta muy planificada puesto que su pareja se desempeñaba anteriormente a trabajar como personal de apoyo en un taller de su localidad y tenia desde siempre el objetivo de  independizarse esperando mejorar sus ingresos económicos a largo plazo. Llevan casi 15 años con el negocio y con los años han logrado consolidarlo como un buen sustento para el desarrollo de su economía familiar ya que ella se encarga de administrar la tienda que expende diversos insumos para la reparación como aceites y repuestos mientras que su esposo brinda el servicio técnico correspondiente. Constantemente busca surtir su negocio con una mayor variedad de productos entre marca y precios para convertirse en una buena opción entre los propietarios y conductores de vehículos que visitan su taller constantemente. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos al por mayor lubricantes y aceites de una reconocida marca que es muy solicitada por sus clientela.
texts.en: Esther is 36 years old and married to Josue.  She has three children, who live at home in a wooden house.  Esther makes a living selling different supplies for maintaining vehicles, and has a garage.  Esther tells us that starting this business was a planned decision.  Her husband previously worked as an assistant at a local garage and he had always wanted to become independent and hoped to increase his long-term income.  The couple has had the business for 15 years and, over the years, they have developed a way to support the family economy. Esther manages the business, selling various supplies, such as oils and spare parts, for repairing vehicles, while her husband is a mechanic.  Esther is constantly looking to stock up the business with a greater variety of products, with different brands and prices, so as to offer a good selection to vehicle owners and drivers who are constantly visiting the shop.  This is Esther's second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  Esther promises to make her repayments on time.  On this occasion Esther is applying for 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy spare parts in bulk, and to buy lubricants and oils in certain brands that are popular with customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants for vehicles.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Walaa is a 26-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and one daughter. Walaa's husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Walaa and her husband would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Walaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for her home. By applying for this loan, the family will reduce their use of electricity for heating water especially in the winter. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for her home

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en: Faysal is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and his daughter in a small house. Faysal is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Faysal would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Faysal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy and a tank for his home. By applying this loan, the family will reduce their use of  electricity for heating water especially in the winter. This will improve the family 's living conditions. Faysal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy and a tank for his home

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla was born in 1992. She lives with her 3 siblings and her parents at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Khawla has been selling clothes for 1 year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. Now she wants to raise the amount of the clothes she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her family. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Shawkat

texts.en: Shawkat is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids, two boys and two girls in a small house. Shawkat is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Shawkat would like to improve the family 's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Shakat took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water heating system othat uses solar energy for his home. By applying this loan, the family will reduce their use of electricity for heating water especially in the winter. This will improve the family's living conditions. Shawkat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water heating system that uses solar energy for his home

loans.name: Rawhi

texts.en: Rawhi is a 50-yea old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small house. Rawhi is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rawhi completed building his new home recently and he spent all of his savings on it. He would like to improve the family's conditions by buying all the needed stuff. Rawhi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. This will improve the family's living conditions. Rawhi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is from Norapat village of Armavir region. He is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. It has already been 5 years Artur that has been earning his family's living by his retail business. He purchases fruits and vegetables from local villagers and using his truck, he transports them to neighboring villages and cities for reselling. Due to his hard and tireless work, Artur is able to sustain his family's basic costs. Unfortunately, now the truck through which Artur transports products is in a nonworking condition. Artur needs financial support to be able to purchase tires for the truck and to be able to continue his retail business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important to Artur and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tires for his truck and to be able to transport the products and sell them to customers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1982. She is divorced and lives at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Fatima has been selling clothes for 1 year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her as she is living alone and depending on herself. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes for her business

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena was born in 1959. She is married and has 11 children. Her husband is a retired man who works as a driver. Ameena has been selling home products for 1 year. She started her project with a small quantity of them. Now she wants to raise the amount of the home products she sells in order to raise her profit and income to be a good financial support for her husband and children, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 61-year-old man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a farmer who mainly grows rice and maize, and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children, and buy more land for expansion.

Inadequate capital, diseases, and pests pose challenges to his production levels, while his plans are to venture into modern farming methods and also build a permanent residential house, since he is now in a mud-wattled dwelling.

Wilson is requesting a loan to pay workers who are weeding his garden, and to buy sprays for his crops.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden and to buy sprays for his crops.

loans.name: Harbiya

texts.en: Harbiya was born in 1967. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is retired. Harbiya has been selling detergents for the past 2 years. She started her business in her home selling small quantities of detergents. Now she wants to buy larger quantities of the detergents to increase her profits in order to be a good financial support for her family. She doesn't have enough money to buy larger quantities now and for this reason, she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more detergents for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is from Iraq. She is 46 years old, married and has four children. Fatima, along with two of her children, helps her husband in providing the family income.
Fatima is a tailor and works from home. Tailoring has been her hobby ever since she was a child but later, in 1990, she started tailoring as a business. She has much experience in this field and has an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.
Fatima is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD. She will use this loan to buy a generator and a new sewing machine. Fatima is aiming to grow her business in order to gain more customers and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.en:
Micheline is a 41-year-old Cameroonian woman, married with five children.  The oldest is 17 and in high school, while the youngest is 5 and in primary school. 

She has been in this business for the past six years, which makes her very experienced, stable, and very profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will help her increase turnover by 50 percent, and her living standard will improve as well.

loans.use: To buy food stuff at wholesale to sell in smaller quantities

loans.name: Top Secret Group

texts.en:
Amani is the featured borrower of Top Secret's group; she got together with her other group members, who are friends, to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  

Amani is a 24-year-old single lady who works as a tutor to make her living, and to pay for her education fees. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her increasing university fees. 

Amani is the lady with the pink shirt at the far right of the picture. As for the other group members, Sariya is the lady at the center, and Mahasen is the lady with a veil covering her hair.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition fees

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Because Manal is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Manal was born in 1975. She lives with her husband and four children in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her husband works in a factory and sells birds. Manal has been helping her husband sell birds for two years. They started their project with a small quantity of birds. 

Now she wants to raise the amount of the birds they sell to raise their profit and income to support her family financially. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: buy more types of birds to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, age 44, is an experienced farmer from the village Anlong Thma of Baray district, Kampong Thom. Her family consists of her husband and her five children, all of whom are married. 

Kim, with the help of her family members, is engaged in farming rice, cassavas, and other seasonal crops on farmland that is around two-hectares. Farming is the sole source of income for the family. Kim usually sells the agricultural products from her home because there are local traders who go through the village to collect the products to sell into the markets.

As the family's needs are increasing day by day, Kim needs to enlarge her areas for planting crops, so she will be able to cover their basic needs. 

Kim would like to acquire a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a piece of land. 

As this is her first loan with Kiva, Kim and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya was born in 1983. She lives in Salt, Jordan with her three siblings and her mother. Her father is deceased. Raya has been trying her best to support her mother financially. She has been raising goats for three years. She started her project with a small number of them. Now she wants to increase the number of goats to raise her profits and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats for her business

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.en:
Sheraly is 29 years old. He lives in a southern part of Tajikistan with his wife, two children and parents. The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry. He is the breadwinner of his family as his wife does not work, his children attend school and his parents are pensioners. He has been busy with fattening cows. He has been in this business for more than two years. 
He wants to develop the business but he does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from the profits he will improve the family's living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 30-year-old Iraqi, married, youth client, who has 4 children and assists her husband in providing for the family. She is a tailor and works from her house. She specializes in tailoring women's and children's outfits and selling them to various customers. Anaam has been in this field since her childhood and has been practicing tailoring as a business since 2000. She is very well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.
Anaam is applying for a youth loan of 1,500 USD in order to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace. She is aiming to grow her business and to increase her profits so she may continue assisting her husband in earning a better income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 20 years old and lives in Salt, Jordan with her 5 siblings and her parents.  One of her brothers is in the military.  Zainab is in her 3rd year of study to earn a Bachelor of Accounting degree.  She is planning to continue her studies and to find a good job in the accounting field after graduation.  

Zainab has applied for this loan to help pay for her upcoming semester fees.  This allows her to help her parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis and are not able to help pay her upcoming education expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester school fees.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi is a 63-year-old woman and an experienced farmer from Ta Pov village of Baray region. She owns a thatched house, where she lives with her husband and unmarried child.  Their three other children have already settled down for marriage. To be able to take care of her family, Yi is engaged in cultivating rice, cassavas and other seasonal crops. Farming is the major source of income for her family. She has been doing farming activities for years with great support from her family members.

In order to keep her agribusiness sustainable, Yi needs a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to buy two cows for the maintenance of the fields. She has never taken a loan from a local financial institution before; this will be her first loan cycle, which will allow her to be able to improve her farming business. 

Yi and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy two cows for the maintenance of the fields.

loans.name: Hourae

texts.en:
Hourae is a married woman from Iraq. She is 20 years old and helps her husband in providing their monthly income. Hourae tailors and sells women's outfits. She has much experience in this field and has been practicing this business since 2007. Hourae is well known in the neighborhood thanks to her professional work with affordable prices.
Hourae is applying for a youth loan of 1,200 USD. She will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and a motor generator. Hourae is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she may provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a motor generator

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf was born in 1987. She is a divorced woman who lives in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour. She has been trying to support herself financially for 2 years now by baking different types of bread and selling it to bakeries. Afaf wants to be more productive to earn a better profit in order to improve her living conditions. She wants to buy more flour and an oven, and to decorate the baking room in her house. As she does not have enough money to do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more flour and an oven, and to decorate the baking room in her house.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa was born in 1969, is divorced, and is trying to support herself financially with her sewing project that she started 3 years ago.  She plans to increase profits by raising her productivity through purchasing a larger quantity of fabric, threads and updating her sewing machines.  She has applied for this loan because she does not have enough money to purchase these items.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, and another electrical sewing machine.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 54 years old, married and has 3 children. Hussain is the sole provider for his family.

Hussain owns a garage where he changes and sells engine oils and filters; he has been in this field since 2005 and has much experience in this field. Hussain has 2 hired employees and is well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to pay the annual rent of his garage. Hussain is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may educate his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his garage

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 45 years old and lives in the town of West Point, Liberia.  She has four children between the ages of 15 and 28, who are attending school and live at home.  For 20 years now she has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, etc.  She started selling these items after she found out that she needed to support herself; so she asked her older sister for some money to start this business.  She likes the business because she is able to make her own money to support her children and pay her own expenses.  

She has requested a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc.  In the future she wants her children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, hinges, nails, etc.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, a rural villager from Battambang province's Banon district, is 51 years old and he has five children, one of whom is still in school. To support his family, he has been working as a teacher for 15 years and supplements the family’s income by making and selling snacks. The current business earns him about US$49 per day but he can save about US$15 each day after daily expenses.
This is the first loan cycle for Phal with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now he is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for his son, specializing in General Management. He highly hopes that this loan will enable him to send his son to university and also helps his son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover his son's entire tuition fee for four years

loans.name: Nikita

texts.en:
Nikita is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia and here is his story.
“Nowadays education is very important. Therefore people find a well-paid job, realize themselves, benefit society and make it better. Education helps people to be happy and successful. I have always had a dream to get a high qualification. I decided that AUCA is the best choice for me. In my opinion, this university offers very good conditions for study. It was not a problem for me to choose the most suitable university. But I found it a little bit problematic to select the faculty. After some contemplation I successfully made my choice, which is Economics. Comparatively recently I found out that I love working with numbers. Mathematics became my favorite subject. I am sure that AUCA will easily help to make me a highly qualified specialist. I would like to mention that AUCA gives many opportunities to its students and one of it is financial aid. I think it is the best way to communicate with students and attract such wonderful ideas and opportunities. I am applying for a Kiva loan, which will help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Abilfaz

texts.en:
Abilfaz is a handyman, he is 37 years old and has been in this business for 10 years. He is married and has three children. One of them is a 7-year-old son who is in 1st grade, the other children are a 4-year-old daughter and a newborn daughter.
Abilfaz has applied for a loan in the amount of 1900 AZN for to buy new materials. He wants to increase his business, and earn more money for his family. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future he wants to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy new materials for his business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning. Aware of this, Gulbahor works as a teacher at a school teaching youngsters of various ages. Gulbahor has worked at the school for more than 10 years. She is one of the best teachers. She has a lot of pupils and all of them love her. Gulbahor has a small salary and it is not enough to provide her family with all necessary things. Her husband Komil is also a worker with a small income. Gulbahor has four children. She often handwashes the clothes of her children and that’s why she needs to buy a washing machine. She is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy a washing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for her household

loans.name: Kinyili

texts.en:
Kinyili is a hardworking woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has sold women's wrap clothes (khangas), selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality  as her major challenge. She also weaves mats and baskets and sells them to town dwellers and passersby.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is a young and smart woman.  She is 18 years old, not married, and lives with her parents.  She was one of the best pupils in her school, where she studied very hard and took part in many competitions.  

Now, Zarrina is a first year university student where she also studies very hard.  She must pay for tuition at the university but does not have the money to do so since her parents have a small income and cannot support her.  Zarrina is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 20 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his divorced mother and his siblings. One of his brothers works at a restaurant. Ahmad is studying a Bachelor of Media. He is in his 3rd year. He is planning to continue his study and to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his mother financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Radi

texts.en:
Radi is a hard working client from Iraq. He is 60 years old and has two wives but no children.

Radi owns a shop where he sells fresh fish and barbecues or fries them according to his customer's requests. He has been practicing this business since 1995 and has gained much experience and fame in the surrounding area.

Radi is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the walls of his shop. Radi is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may enhance his current financial conditions and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the walls.

loans.name: Muhusu

texts.en:
Muhusu lives and works in the West Point area. She is married to a local businessman. She did not attend school and has five children between 13 and 27.
 
Muhusu is engaged in the sale of rice and soup in the local market. She has more customers but she doesn’t really have enough income to buy more food ingredients for her cook shop (restaurant).
 
Muhusu enjoys her business because she makes lots of profit, and this profit helps her to care for her children and pay her house rent. She plans to build a house for her children and send all her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients for her cook shop.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Armavir town. He lives with his wife and three children. Near the house where he lives, Robert owns a small laboratory where he provides dental services. Due to his kind attitude and high quality work, Robert has many customers. 

Because of the family's expenses, Robert isn't able to save money and renovate his laboratory. Robert has applied for this loan in order to renovate the laboratory. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Robert to be able to provide better conditions for his clients and continue providing dental services.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his dental laboratory

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 33 years old. Her family consists of her husband and four children. She lives with them in a small house in Bakan district of Pursat province. 

She has been a farmer working on a few plots of farmland for nearly 14 years. She mentioned that this year is a bad year for her villagers because of the flood. Eng is pictured in front of her house, which was flooded in the previous couple months.

In order to improve the living conditions of her family, Eng aims to build a latrine in the household. Due to insufficient money, she would like to acquire a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to buy materials needed for building a latrine and to pay labor costs. This will promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is grateful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for building a latrine and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Zilfar

texts.en:
Zilfar is married with 7 children. Five of his children are married. One of his children works and another studies His wife is a housewife and Zilfar is a master craftsman, so that he repairs houses and builds and paints walls. They live in the Baku region.

Now Zilfar wants to improve his business and he has applied for a loan from Komak. He needs 1,900 AZN--with this amount he wants to buy assorted work supplies, for example different paint colors, paint brushes, etc.

He thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid. In the future he wants to get an assistant to help with his business.

loans.use: to buy various work supplies

loans.name: Riziki Mupya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ruvuga est une conseillère du collectif de crédit « Riziki Mupya », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 23 ans  et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un chauffeur taximan(motard). La cliente est  une vendeuse des souliers. Elle installe ses articles à un point de vente animé de son quartier (au long de la rue). Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son familier. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 paires des souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle. Les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Ruvuga, is an advisor of the loan collective "Riziki Mupya". She is a young entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 23 years old, and a mother of four children, who are all students. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ruvuga is a shoe vendor. She sets up her merchandise to sell at a busy spot in her district (along the street). She started her business with family assistance. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for seven years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 20 pairs of shoes. Thus, she would like to provide schooling to her children and to expand her business plans. Challenges for developing her business include exchange losses.  

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of shoes to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en: Vigen lives in Armavir. He is married and has three children: a nine-year-old son and three-year-old twins. Vigen is a musician by profession. For 18 years Vigen has been playing in one of the local restaurants as well as at different ceremonies (wedding, baptisms, etc). He plays different instruments and sometimes provides his musical instruments to other musicians for rent. A talented man, Vigen is well known among the locals. He now needs financial support to purchase a drum. The purchase of one more musical instrument will give Vigen an opportunity to expand the service that he provides to his customers. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is greatly important for Vigen and he hopes for lender support.

loans.use: to pay for a new musical instrument.

loans.name: Hisam

texts.en:
Hisam is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and father of two children. Hisam is the only provider of the family.

Hisam owns a grocery store where he provides all the basic needs of a house like dairy products, canned foods, drinks and detergents. He established his business in 2005 and has gained good experience in this field. Now, he has a part-time employee hired and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hisam is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. This loan will be used to renovate his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell. Hisam is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Charlote

texts.en:
Charlote is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Nalbandyan village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 21-year-old son and 5-year-old daughter. Ashot's son works at local store as a seller and helps his father with sustaining the family's living. Ashot's wife takes care of the household and their little daugher. 

Ashot provides taxi service. He has been involved in this activity for 3 years. Realizing the importance of income that he gets from taxi driving business, Ashot applied for this loan. The loan will greatly assist him to renovate the car and be able to continue his business. Ashot has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Ashot and his family and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for taxi renovations

loans.name: Famate

texts.en:
Famate is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She completed 12th grade before starting her business and is married with a seven-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home.
Famate has been selling used clothes and other assorted goods for the past seven years. She does not experience any difficulties with her business.
Famate is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build her own house and send her child to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Jamilan

texts.en: Jamilan is a 42-year-old lady; she has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and sells them around the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. He is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: La Source Group

texts.fr: La cliente Madawa est une Secrétaire du collectif de crédit « La source », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un enseignant dans une école d’établissement privé. La cliente est  une vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses articles à un point de vente animé de son quartier (à l’arrondissement d’une avenue). Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son conjoint. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une belle maison. Les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Madawa, age 32, is a young and energetic entrepreneur with a good experience. She's a member of La Source Group and the mother of three children, who all go to school. Her husband is a teacher in a private school.

Madawa sells secondhand clothing. She sets up her point of sale in a busy location in her neighborhood, at the corner of an avenue.

She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running her business for three years.

This new loan will be used to buy one bale of secondhand clothing. Thus, she would like to provide an education for her children, expand her business, and build a nice home. Currency exchange losses are challenges for the development of her business.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to make women who are excluded by traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical time of war in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bale of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George sells vegetables at the local market to earn an income. He is extremely grateful for the positive changes that occurred in his life thanks to his previous Kiva loan. It enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income, which improved the living standards for himself and for his child, who attends school.

He is requesting a new loan in the amount of KSH 35,000. He will use his loan funds to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to offer for sale.

George thanks Yehu and his Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: Raisa is a 25-year-old married lady. She has two children. For the past three years she has been running a beauty parlor business and she enjoys a good reputation in her community. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  Because she has low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her 3rd loan of PKR 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful of catering for more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Farohat

texts.en:
Farohat is an entrepreneur who is married and has three children. 

She has been busy with animal husbandry more than three years. Little by little with the passing of the time she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad from her work. 

She is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her son access to be a better quality education and a financial stability that will allow him to progress. 

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy young cattle for increasing working capital and to develop business further. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Mitsanze

texts.en:
Mitsanze appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards and enabled him to expand on his business and earn a higher income.

He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase cartridges and printing papers for his business. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cartridges and printing papers for his business.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibehera est une présidente du collectif de crédit « Mapatano », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique,  âgée de 43 ans et  mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant. La cliente est sociétaire d’un kiosque (une vendeuse de divers). En plus, elle est couturière. Elle installe son kiosque  à un point de vente animé de son quartier. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les divers (2 sacs de sucres, 1 bidon d’huile de table, allumettes, 2 box de bonbons, 2 box de biscuits, 1 casier de Fanta, 1 carton de jus, 1 box de lotion, savon de toilette, 6 pièces de pagnes, 10 paires de souliers, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une seconde parcelle. La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kibehera, age 43, is the president of Mapatano Group. She's a very energetic entrepreneur with a lot of experience. She's the mother of four children, who all go to school. Her husband is a merchant.

Kibehera has a stall, where she sells various products. In addition, she's a seamstress. She sets up her stall in a busy location in her neighborhood.

She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running her business for four years.

This new loan will be used to buy various products (two sacks of sugar, one can of cooking oil, matches, two boxes of candies, two boxes of biscuits, one crate of Fanta, one box of juice, one box of lotion, toilet soap, six "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), ten pairs of shoes, etc).

Thus, she hopes to send her children to school, expand her business, and buy a second lot of land. Sales on credit and currency exchange losses are challenges for the development of her business, 

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to make women who are excluded by traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical time of war in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, matches, candies, biscuits, juice, soap, etc

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 32-year-old lady; she has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Fardoos

texts.en:
Fardoos, age 43, raises and sells animals to earn an income. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them at the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute necessary funds to the family income. 

In order to meet her household needs, Fardoos needs to improve her business. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of Rs. 25,000, which she will use to purchase another calf.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she is confident that she will expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Rubaika

texts.en:
Rubaika, age 41, offers tailoring services to her neighbors and members of her local community. She works hard to provide much-needed funds to help her husband support the family. Her income helps to offer the family a decent life. She is known in the community for her mastery of stitching techniques.

In order to help her continue operations of her business, Rubaika has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PKR. With her loan funds, she will buy a stock of thread in different colors along with the packs of zippers and buttons. This investment will allow her to meet with increasing demand from her customers. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use the revenues from her increased income to provide for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with the packs of zippers and buttons

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking and enterprising woman.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of five. The man shown in the photo is Kaneez’s husband. She, along with her husband, is running a business making crackers. They deliciously make them at home and then sell to the people of their community and make enough through this business. 

Kaneez has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees]. This will help her to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase their sales. Kaneez hope to have an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour for making crackers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She’s married with six children between the ages of 4 and 20, and all of her children are currently in school.

Hawa has been selling oil, pepper, salt and charcoal. For the past eight years Hawa has been doing this business in her community market, but the major problem she faces is that the transportation cost to bring in her commodities is too high.

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, salt and charcoal for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, salt and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Bemola

texts.en:
Bemola is 35 years old and her husband is 42 years old. Bemola is a housewife and her husband runs a cycle shop. Bemola is illiterate and just knows how to sign her name and her husband has passed grade 6. Bemola has two children and none of them receives education. 

Prior to his business her husband was engaged in a cycle shop where he learned repairing work. Taking those experiences he has opened his own shop where he sells parts and repairs cycles. But due to the competitive market, there are many of these shops nearby, so it becomes very difficult for them to sell the parts and also to repair. 

For this reason they need money to decorate the shop and to purchase many modern parts for cycles so that it attracts the customer. Hence Bemola has taken a loan from BJS so that they can purchase different modern cycle parts and can enhance their business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of cycle parts for selling.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en: Pratima is a 38-year-old married woman and her husband is 45 years old. Pratima is illiterate and just knows how to sign her name. Her husband is class VIII pass (grade 8). Pratima is a housewife and her husband has a jute business. She is the mother of one child. Her husband buys jute from the market and makes many jute handicrafts to sell in the market. The quality of jute items depends on the quality of the jute, but better quality jute requires more money to purchase. Jute is a very profitable business. To help her husband, Pratima is taking out a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity of 15,000 Indian rupees so that he can buy good quality jute. They hope that buying good quality jute will enable them to sell more products in the market so they can expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase jute for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Taramoni

texts.en: Taramoni is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is 55 years old. Taramoni is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. From the beginning, they have struggled a lot to run their family. Both the children are in school. Her husband decided to farm because he owns the land and they will be able to keep all profits. Taramoni has taken out a loan so that they can cultivate gourds on their land, which will add another variety of vegetable that they can sell in the market to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural items like seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides for cultivation of gourds.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Majali

texts.en:
Majali is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives at the coastal region of Kenya. 

For the past two years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 he wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 44-year-old woman; she has been successfully running a business of selling milk for many years. Over time, Shamim has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  

To meet the increasing demand of her customers, Shamim  requested a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] through Kashf Foundation. It will help her to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings through her larger sales, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi sells charcoal to earn an income. She has operated her business for the past three years. Her primary clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. With her Kshs 50,000 loan, she will purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer muy trabajadora, para poder salir adelante y llevar un sustento a su hogar, tiene su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de material reciclado desde hace 7 años, con lo cual poco a poco está saliendo adelante, Yolanda cree que le vabien en su negocio porque e smuy responsable y sobre todo porque es muy dedicada.

Yolanda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una mototaxi para poder transportar los productos que ofrece, de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder ser una gran microempresaria”.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working woman. For 7 years she has had a small business buying and selling recycled material in order to get on in life and provide sustenance for her household, and with this she is gradually making progress. Yolanda thinks her business is going well because she is very responsible and above all very dedicated.

Yolanda is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy a mototaxi so she can transport the products she sells. By doing this she will be able to improve her business and carry on working towards making her dream come true: to give her children a professional career and to be a great micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey lives with his parents in Gyumri town. Near the house where they live, Sergey rents a small garage where he provides vehicle-repair services. He offers different types of services for auto owners who value Sergey's high quality work. 

Currently, by applying for this loan, Sergey wants to purchase equipment that he needs for providing vehicle-repair services. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is greatly important for Sergey. He works really hard for gathering enough income for covering his family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for providing vehicle-repair services.

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Kiso est une conseillère du groupement de crédit « Justice », entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un homme d’affaire commissionnaire. La cliente est  une vendeuse des bijoux. En plus, elle vend occasionnellement des pagnes. Elle installe ses articles  au marché public, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les colliers de bijoux. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une jolie maison. Les vols, les impayés sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kiso, is an advisor of the loan group "Justice". She is a young entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, and a mother of four children, who are all students. Her husband is a broker. Kiso is a jewelry vendor. In addition, she occasionally sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She sets up her merchandise at the public market and sometimes at her home. She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for twelve years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase jeweled necklaces. Thus, she would like to provide schooling to her children, expand her business plans, and build a nice house. Challenges for developing her business include theft and outstanding debt.  

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase jeweled necklaces to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 51-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. Perveen dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Wakeela

texts.en:
Wakeela, age 51, is a married woman and the mother of four children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and married to Joshua. Together, they are blessed with two children. She sells clothes in Kericho, which is served by KADET's Kericho office. This has been her income-generating business for the last three years. The business generates an average monthly income of 12,000 KES [Kenyan shillings]. 

She plans to use the amount borrowed of 30,000 KES to purchase shirts, trousers, ties and blouses for sale. She plans to plow back the anticipated profits into the business. Her dream is to buy a house for her family so that she can invest the money she spends on rent.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, trousers, ties and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab, age 37, is a married woman and a mother six children. She beautifully makes handicrafts by using bamboo to make items, such as wall hangings, racks, and boxes. She has been doing it for the past two years, with the support of her husband. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Zainab applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. With this loan, she will be able to purchase bundles of bamboo of good quality. She is in her second loan cycle, with good credit history. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of bamboo of good quality.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 35 years old, married to Kipkorir, and she provides for three members of her family. She runs a matatu (local transportation) business in Kapsabet town, served by Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last three years. The  business generates an average monthly income of KES 35,000.

Evaline plans to use the amount borrowed, KES 30,000, to do repairs and maintenance of her matatu, in addition to financing her horticulture business. She plans to reinvest the anticipated profits into the business.

loans.use: Evaline will use this loan to do repairs and maintenance of her matatu, in addition to financing her horticulture business.

loans.name: Guadalupe Cote Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guadalupe Cote” pertenece a una comunidad muy chica la mayoría de las personas se conocen entre ellas, es una comunidad Mazahua las personas a un conservan su lengua materna sus trajes típicos son muy coloridos y vistosos, para entrar a la comunidad solo es en transporte especial o caminando ya que el autobús solo entra dos veces al día y en horas muy diferentes. El grupo está conformado por cinco mujeres ellas son muy buenas amigas se conocen desde hace varios años. Doña Leticia o  Lety  tiene 35 años de edad está casada con el señor Alejandro desde hace 16 años  juntos han formado una familia con dos niños de los cuales aun están estudiando. Doña Lety se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace 10 años, platica que decidió iniciar esta actividad porque sus suegros también eran panaderos. Doña Lety su esposo y otros miembros de su familia elaboran el pan en un cuarto muy pequeñito donde tienen un horno, todo el proceso es hecho a mano no cuentan con ninguna herramienta, todos los días Doña Lety y sus familiares se encuentran trabajando en la elaboración de sus panes, para hacer su pan llevan un proceso muy laborioso pero mientras están trabajando el horno tiene que estar muy caliente para estar listo a la hora de meter el pan, en la elaboración de su pan deben pesar su harina para calcular la cantidad de azúcar, solo ponen harina, azúcar y la mezclan en agua para poder moldear el pan de bolillo. Doña Lety comento “Nuestras dificultades son la falta de herramientas para facilitarnos el trabajo, el precio de la harina es muy cara también cuando el precio del azúcar sube mucho” Por eso el crédito que está solicitando a Vision Fund y KIVA a Lety, Silvia, Irene, Aracely, Cristina  les ayudara de mucho porque podrán comprar harina y azúcar para la elaboración del pan porque ya se acerca la celebración del día de muertos y es cuando mas vende y tienen encargos ya seguros. Ellas están muy contentas y agradecidas porque su crédito les ayudara mucho y más porque sus ganancias serán muy buenas. El sueño de Doña Lety es poder seguir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos para que puedan tener una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
The “Guadalupe Cote” group belongs to a very small community where most people know each other. They are a Mazahua community who preserve their mother tongue and their traditional clothing is very colourful and attractive. To get to the community it is only possible to go by special transport or on foot since the bus only goes a couple of times a day at strange times. The group is made up of 5 women who are good friends and have known each other for several years. Leticia or 'Lety' is 35 years old and has been married to Alejandro for 16 years. Together they have 2 children who are still at school. 

For the last 10 years Lety has earned a living baking bread. She says she decided to go into this business as her in-laws were also bakers. Lety, her husband and other family members make the bread in a very small room where they have an oven. The whole process is done by hand and they have no tools. Every day Lety and her relatives can be found making their bread. The bread making process is very laborious and while they are working the oven needs to be very hot so that it is ready for the bread to go in. To make the bread they need to weigh the flour in order to calculate the quantity of sugar. They only use flour and sugar mixed with water to make their bread rolls. Lety said: " Our difficulties are the lack of tools to make our work easier, the price of flour is very expensive as well and the price of sugar is going up a lot."

For these reasons the loan which Lety, Silvia, Irene, Aracely and Cristina are asking for from Kiva and Vision Fund will help them a great deal since they will be able to buy flour and sugar for making the bread. The celebration of the Day of the Dead is approaching and this is when they sell the most and have already secured orders.

They are very happy and grateful because their loan will help them a lot and more so because their profits will be good. Lety's dream is to continue supporting her children in their schooling so that they can have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy flour.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
This is Nyevu, whose previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase raw materials for use in making brooms. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Nyevu would like to apply for a loan, this time for 20,000 Kshs, to buy more raw materials for her business. The more brooms displayed at the store, the better.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 33-year-old vigorous, married lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has attained a regular list of customers. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
At the age of 44, Zahida is a hardworking lady. Involved in manufacturing leather bags and wallets for a period of about 20 years, she is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Zahida makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase a stock of leather materials in various colors along with packs of beads and pearls for embellishment. Now in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history, Zahida hopes to boost her earnings through increased sales, and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of leather materials in various colors along with packs of beads and pearls.

loans.name: Niamat

texts.en:
Niamat is 41 years old and a vigorous lady.  She has been running business selling cloths in her community, and she uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of funds, she was unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 through the Kashf Foundation and used that money to buy a variety of cloths for the winter season. 

It helped her in meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to grow her business, thereby providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Mynnor

texts.es: Mynnor, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa e  hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abono y ayudarse con la mano de obra, el desea realizar una siembra de frijoles , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Mynnor is an entrepreneurial man. He is married and lives with his wife and children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as manure and assistance with labour. He hopes to cultivate a crop of beans, maintaining them in good condition during the growing season, to have a good harvest. His only limitation is a lack of money to continue to grow. Because his family depends on this economic activity to move forward, he is requesting a loan. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not taken other loans from State-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 32 years old, married to Felician, and together they are blessed with two children. She runs a chemist business in Kapsabet town and is served by the KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last two years. The business generates an average monthly income of 75,000 KES. She plans to use the amount borrowed of 30,000 KES to buy additional drugs for her chemist business. She plans to put back the anticipated profits into the business.

loans.use: to buy additional drugs for her chemist business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sophia is 32 years old and single, and she provides for two members of her family. 

She runs a business selling shoes in the Kapsuser location, which is served by KADET's Kericho office. This has been her income-generating business for the last seven years. It generates an average monthly income of KES 18,000.

She plans to use the borrowed amount of KES 60,000 to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business.
