loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kaskete est une trésorière du collectif de crédit « Sinaï », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 47 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est sans emploi,toute fois, il réalise parfois de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelles. La cliente est sociétaire d’un kiosque(une vendeuse de divers). Elle installe son kiosque à un point de vente animé de son quartier. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les divers (2 sacs de sucres, 1 bidon d’huile de table, allumettes, 2 box de bonbons,2 box de biscuits,1 casier de Fanta,1 carton de jus,1 box de lotion,savon de toilette,6 pièces de pagnes,10 paires de souliers, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison. La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kaskete, age 47, is a treasurer for the loan collective Sinaï. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. Her spouse is unemployed, although he occasionally earns a small commission on the sale of land. 

Kaskete is part owner of a booth where she sells various goods. She sets up the booth in a busy area of her neighborhood. She started her business with support from her husband, and later received a loan from the Hekima MFI. She has been conducting this activity for seven years. 

Kaskete will use this new loan to buy various merchandise (2 bags of sugar, 1 jug of table oil, some matches, 2 boxes of candy, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 case of Fanta, 1 carton of juice, 1 box of lotion, some soap, 6 pagnes, 10 pairs of shoes and more.). 

Her goals are to support her children’s education, expand her business and build a house. The challenges she is facing in developing her activity include selling on credit and exchange losses.  

Kaskete wishes to extend her sincere thanks to the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen excluded from traditional banking to become self-sufficient, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 jug of table oil, some matches, 2 boxes of candy, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 case of Fanta, 1 carton of juice, 1 box of lotion, some soap, 6 pagnes, 10 pairs of shoes and more.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 35,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his wife. 

Rubik is a taxi driver, with ten years of experience. Over these years of hard work, Rubik gained a good list of clients who use only Rubik's taxi. Unfortunately, because of the high costs of living, Rubik wasn't able to save money for the renovation of the car. 

Currently, the car needs to be renovated since it is now in non-working condition and Rubik isn't able to drive the taxi. He has applied for this loan for the help. The loan will greatly assist Rubik in paying for the renovation of the car and he will be able to gather income for his family. 

Rubik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Rubik hopes for your support since the car and taxi service are a very important source of income for Rubik and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the car.

loans.name: Beatrice T.

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old, and she lives in West Point.  She’s married to a local businessman, and they has four children between the ages of 3 and 17, three of them in school. 

For the past four years Beatrice has been  running a little restaurant where she sells African dishes.  She make a lot of profit since she has a lot of customers.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase meat, rice, oil, coal, fish, etc., for her business. She plans to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, rice, oil, coal, fish, etc., for her restaurant

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 48 years old. He has seven children and they all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, Evariste wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter, son and daughter-in-law in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Maguli is a cook at local restaurant and earns 400 GEL per month. Her son works in building and has a small monthly salary. The existing income is not enough for the family and Maguli decided to start her own business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to purchase home appliances (plastics and so on) to resell among her co-workers and neighbors. The Start Up loan will be a great support for her family, as her income will be increased. Wiith increased income Maguli will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin a business selling home appliances

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard  is 26 years old, married to Rose and provides for two members of his family. He sells milk in a Kosoiyuno location and is served by KADET's Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for one year. From this business he gets a monthly income of 1,000 KES. He is borrowing 30,000 KES to buy additional milk to sell. With the anticipated profits, he will buy an additional cow and also provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy additional milk to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

Leah has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years.  She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 44 years old, married to Julius and supports four members of her family. She runs a dairy farming business in Kabutie, served by KADET's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last 20 years. The dairy farming business generates an average monthly income of 10,600 KES.She plans to use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy another dairy cow. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 34 years old, married and supports a family of four members.  He is a motorcycle operator offering transportation services in the location of Kabarnet and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to add to his savings and purchase a new motorcycle.  The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To expand his current business and add another motorcycle

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is from Gyumri town where she lives with her husband and two grown-up children. Susanna's elder daughter is married and lives separately with her family. In two years, Susanna has been involved in a retail business. She purchases different clothing and dress-making supplies from the city market and resells it in Yeghegnadzor town where her daughter lives. The profit from this activity is very important for Susanna and her family and she needs to enlarge it. She asks for this loan to purchase clothing to sell to her customers. Susanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Susanna and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 37 years old and lives in West Point. She has five children between five months old and twelve years old respectively. Only four of them attend school. 

For the past ten years she has been cooking and selling delicious African dishes in the local market, where she enjoys being there. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, Vita, salt, meat, etc. for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house on it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, Vita, salt, meat, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old and married. She provides for four members of her family. She runs a grocery business in Kapsor and is served by KADET Kericho office. 

She has been in the grocery business for the last four years and earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES. She has borrowed 60,000 KES and plans to use it to purchase potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en:
Appolinaire is 60 years old and is a father of four. He has been a maize farmer for the past four years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 37 years old, married and supports four members of her family. Her spouse also helps support the family. She has a retail business in Kamobo served by KADET's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last two years. Florence gets an average monthly income of 12,000 KES. She plans to use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy wheat floor, cooking fat and sugar as additional stock for her retail business. Her dream is to expand her business and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat floor, cooking fat and sugar as additional stock for her retail business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 27 years old, and she enjoys being able to provide for her two nieces and nephew from the profits she earns operating her Zoona mobile money outlet.  Right now she is able to pay for the children’s school fees and other basic necessities, which she is thankful for.  

Pamela’s first loan allowed her to add to her working capital and open an additional outlet in the town of Mazabuka, which is located in the southern province of Zambia.  Now, Pamela is requesting another loan to help her add working capital float (the money used to serve customers) for her outlet in Mazabuka.  The additional capital will allow her to serve more customers in need of financial services and bring her additional revenue. 

Pamela is working hard to grow her existing outlets so she can continue to open new ones and earn more income while providing her community with needed financial services.

loans.use: To grow her mobile money business to service more customers in her community who need financial services

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 46 years old. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer. She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production. She needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 28 years old and married.  He supports three members of his family. 

He runs a retail shop in the Kosonywo location, which is served by the Kadet Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the past three years.  From this business he gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Geofrey has borrowed KES 30,000 that he will use to buy cooking fat, sugar, tea, and wheat flour.  He will use the anticipated profits to start another retail shop business.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar, tea, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is aged 56. He has spent four years in maize production. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old, married to Samson, and supports seven members of her family. She runs a grocery shop business in Kapsabet town, which is served by KADET Kapsabet office. 

This has been her income-generating business for the last twenty two years. The business generates an average monthly income of KES 50,000. She plans to use the amount of KES 30,000 borrowed to buy maize, beans, and green grams for sale. She plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and green grams for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está soltero y vive con su familia. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de alimento para el engorde de unos cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos . El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Manuel is 31 years old, single, and lives with his family.  He plans to use this loan to buy feed to fatten up some pigs.  Manuel has a number of pigs.  He wants to have his animals at the ideal weight in order to sell them at the local or nearby markets.  Manuel wants to earn higher profits to support his and his family's well-being and so he can expand his business.  This is Manuel's first loan with "FUDECOSUR".  He has not had any loans from state banks and "FUDECOSUR" has provided this loan under better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es: Arnulfo tiene 34 años de edad estudio una carrera técnica y es soltero,  vive en una comunidad muy tranquila se caracteriza por las fiestas patronales de la misma localidad sus habitantes son personas mazahuas y aun conservan su lengua materna sus trajes típicos que son de colores muy vivos, Arnulfo tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace cinco años, inicialmente el negocio era de su abuelo él fue quien la inicio, durante 50 años la atendió pero cuando el señor falleció, la tienda de abarrotes dejó de funcionar por tres años, Arnulfo le había prometido a su abuelo mantener la tienda de abarrotes como siempre la había conservado, anteriormente la tienda de su abuelo se encontraba ubicada en una casa de teja, madera y sus paredes están construidas de adobe (material hecho con tierra) era una casa construida por su abuelo es una de las casas mas viejas en la comunidad, los anaqueles, las ventanas las puertas están hechas de madera, para Arnulfo es una casa a la cual la tiene mucho cariño piensa resguardarla por siempre porque fue un regalo de su abuelo, Arnulfo lleva cinco años haciéndose cargo de la tienda esta muy contento con la tienda de abarrotes siempre le han gustado las ventas porque su papá también era comerciante, esta vez Arnulfo esta solicitando un credito para comprar productos como, leche, pan, huevo, refrescos, detergentes, etc. El necesita de este credito para poder comprar mas mercancía y no dejar caer su negocio porque su reto es la competencia, vive en el centro de su comunidad pero también hay dos tiendas muy grandes siempre trata de ser muy atento con sus clientes para ganárselos, nunca ha pensado en abandonar la tienda porque le prometió a su abuelo conservarla, Aunque también desea llegar a tener mas animales como cerdos, bueyes, gallos de pelea, porque antes su papá tenia un rancho con muchos animales pero desgraciadamente los cerdos se contagiaron con un virus y no pudo continuar con la cria de sus animales. A Arnulfo le gustaría tener los mismos animales en un futuro, esta muy seguro de lograrlo con sus ahorros obtenidos de la tienda de abarrotes, de la venta de gas, y la venta de gallos.
texts.en: Arnulfo is 34 years old, studied at a technical college, and is single.  He lives in a peaceful community known for its national festivals.  The inhabitants come from the "mazahua" indigenous tribe and keep up their mother tongue and brightly-coloured traditional clothes.  Arnulfo has had a grocery store for six years.  It first belonged to his grandfather, who worked there for 50 years.  However, when he died, no one worked in the shop for three years.  Arnulfo had promised his grandfather that he would keep the shop just as his grandfather had always kept it.    Previously, Arnulfo's grandfather's shop was in a house made of tiles and wood, with adobe walls (a material made with earth.  Arnulfo's grandfather build the house, and it is one of the oldest in the community.  The shelves, doors, and window frames were all made of wood.  For Arnulfo, this house has a lot of character, and he wants to keep it forever as it was a present from his grandfather.  Arnulfo has been running the shop for five years and he is very happy with it.  He has always liked working in sales as his father was a businessman too.  On this occasion Arnulfo is applying for a loan in order to buy items such as milk, bread, eggs, refreshments, detergents, and more. He needs this loan to buy more merchandise and so that the business does not collapse.  Arnulfo's current challenge is dealing with competition.  Arnulfo lives in the centre of his community but there are also two very big shops.  Arnulfo always tries to be very attentive with his customers so that they become loyal.  Arnulfo has never thought about leaving the business because he promised his uncle that he wouldn't.  Arnulfo's father used to have a ranch with many animals and Arnulfo would like to have more animals, such as pigs, oxen, and fighting cocks.  However, unfortunately, he had pigs who became infected with a virus, and he was unable to continue with this work.  Arnulfo would like to have more animals in the future and he is sure that he will manage it with the saving he will earn from the grocery store, from selling gas, and from selling roosters.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, sugar, and more.

location.town: Barrio San Francisco, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Onesphore

texts.en:
Onesphore is 42 years old. He is married with four children who all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расулу 56 лет. Он живет в районе Спитамен. Расул женат и имеет 2 сыновей, которые уже обзаведены семьями и живут в доме отца. Его оба сыновей работают на стройке. Сам Расул работает в электро подстанции района. Параллельно последние 10 лет он занимается скотоводством и растениеводством. Расул арендует 1 га земельного участка, где каждый год выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. К тому же он успевает работать на скотном дворе. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот и в дальнейшем продает на скотном рынке. Расулу в ведении сельского хозяйства и в выращивании скота усердно помогают жена и невестки. Сейчас в хозяйстве Расула осталась одна корова и Расул хотел бы увеличить поголовье скота. На деньги от кредита он собирается приобрести еще одну корову лучшей породы с целью дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Такая корова стоит очень дорого и ее стоимость достигает до 1000 долларов США.
texts.en: Rasul is 56 years old, married, and lives in the Spitamen District in Tajikistan. He has two married sons who live at home with him. Both of his sons work at a construction site and Rasul works at the electrical substation. He has also been raising cattle and planting crops on the side for ten years. Rasul leases one hectare of land for planting wheat and corn every year. He also spends time in the barnyard breeding cattle to sell at the livestock market. Rasul works hard to support his wife and daughters-in-law. He only has one cow right now and would like to buy another of the best breed in order to fatten it up and resell. This cow is very expensive and costs up to $1000.

loans.use: to purchase a cow of the best breed to fatten and resell

loans.name: Banco De Piedra Group

texts.es: El grupo “Banco de Piedra” está conformado por siete integrantes, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila donde generalmente las personas se dedican al cultivo de maíz. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque en la comunidad donde viven hay un banco donde se extrae la piedra la cual se utiliza para construcción de las viviendas. Francisca o Fran como así le dicen de cariño es una integrante del grupo ella tiene 36 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Antonio desde hace 10 años juntos han formado una familia con dos niños de los cuales se encuentran estudiando su educación primaria. Fran se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos para después venderlos con su actividad tiene tres años, platica que la inicio porque cuando le ofrecieron el crédito decidió comprar borregos y además porque es una actividad muy cómoda para ella no necesita invertir mucho tiempo, cuando puede los lleva al campo a pastar también aprovecha para llevarse a sus niños y así jugar con ellos en lo que sus borregos están comiendo, la única dificultad de Doña Fran es cuando sus borregos llegan a enfermarse  pero cuando puede y tiene las posibilidades consulta con el veterinario y así puede salvar a sus borregos. Esta vez está solicitando crédito a la institución para comprar cuatro borreguitos chicos está muy agradecida porque así podrá comprar sus animalitos y venderá en algunos meses, “Con mis ganancias puedo ayudarle a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar y comprar algunas cosas necesarias para su educación como pagar útiles escolares, pagar cooperaciones en la escuela, comprar zapatos etc. Los integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en venta de cosméticos, Alberta y Don Mario  en una tienda de abarrotes, Rosa, Laura, Francisca y Basilia invertirán en borregos.
texts.en: The group "Banco de Piedra" (Stone Quarry) is made up of seven members. They live in a very quiet community where the people generally make a living by growing corn. They chose this name for their group because where they live there is a stone quarry from which they quarry stone to build their houses. Francisca, or Fran as they call her in a friendly way, is a group member; she is 36 years old and has been living with Mr. Antonio for 10 years. They have two children together who are going to elementary school. Fran works breeding sheep; she fattens them and then sells them. She has been doing this for three years. She says that she started this business because, when they offered her the loan, she decided to buy sheep and also because it is very convenient for her; she doesn't need to invest a lot of time in it, when she has the time she takes her sheep to the pasture to graze and takes her children with her as well to play with them while the sheep are eating. The only problem Mrs. Fran has is that sometimes her sheep get sick. Whenever she can and has the means to do it, she takes her sheep to a veterinarian to save them. This time she is requesting the loan to purchase four young sheep. She is very grateful for this opportunity because she will be able to buy her animals and sell them in a few months: "With my profit I can help my husband with our living expenses and buy necessary things for the education of our children such as school material, shoes etc., as well as pay their school tuition." The other members of the group are Teresa, who will use the money to sell cosmetics; Alberta and Mr. Mario, who will invest the money in a convenience store; and Rosa, Laura, Francisca and Basilia who will use the loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy four sheep

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Delisa

texts.en:
Delisa is a 29-year-old mother of two children, ages 10 and 7.  She operates a Zoona mobile money outlet where customers can access needed financial services. Delisa’s first loan allowed her to purchase a trading booth, which brought her more customers and profits. This enabled her to move into a better house with more room for her kids.
  
Deslisa’s second loan will help her grow the existing business by increasing her working capital that is needed to serve her customer base. With more working capital, she has the opportunity to serve more customers in need of financial services, such as sending and receiving of money.
  
Delisa’s dream is to continue to work hard and grow the business so she can earn enough profits to build a house one day.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money business by increasing her working capital that is needed to serve her customer base.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 26 years old and lives in the West Point area. She is married with a 2-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For the past six years she has been involved in the sale of onions, Irish potatoes, etc. Her challenge is rising prices. She started this business with a small amount of money from her mother and she has learned this way of selling from her mother. 

What she likes about this business is that it helps her take care of her child and makes her feel proud of having her own money. She has requested this loan to purchase more onions, Irish potatoes, etc.  Her future plan is to educate her child, and attend a university since she is a high school graduate.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie is 45 years old. She is married with seven children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 63 years old. She is a widow, and she has been in the maize farming for two years. 

She would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production; she needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase her harvest. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a happily married father of two.  He is requesting a loan so he can serve more customers who need financial services from his Zoona mobile money transfer business in Luanshya, Zambia.

Benjamin feels fortunate to be connected to Kiva lenders. He says through the financial help he got from Kiva lenders, he was able to serve customers who needed to send larger amounts from his shop.  

Unfortunately, Benjamin’s business suffered a mishap when a fire broke out at his shop, and he lost some money in the fire.  He has had to start his business all over again. 

This loan will provide Benjamin with the working capital he had prior to the fire accident.  Currently, he is operating with very little working capital, which is barely enough to serve customers in need of financial services.  

Benjamin is confident this loan will help him as he rebuilds his business.

loans.use: To re-build his capital after suffering a fire

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Israa is a 24-year-old married woman from a small village near Qalqilia city. She lives with her husband and son in a very simple house. Israa's husband is a worker with a low and unstable income. He also works in agriculture. He started planting his land two years ago. He would like to develop his farm and increase his income.

Israa requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy seeds and seedlings for his farm. This will improve the farm conditions and prepare it for the winter crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for her husband's farm.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is 22 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Deir el Balah. Her husband works in a library where he sells stationary and office supplies. Walaa is a student in a local university where she studies psychology. She hopes to earn her BA degree and find a good job in the future. 

Walaa is requesting a loan from FATEN, which she will use to buy a new laptop for her studies. With the laptop, she will be able to write her homework and reports easily.  She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 23-year-old young man. He lives in a small village in Ambrolauri district with his mother, brother, sister-in-law, and infant nephew. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow, a pig, a vineyard and walnut trees. His mother milks the cow and produces dairy products.

In addition, they produce wine and sell with the dairy products at local markets. George is unemployed and decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,400 GEL for purchasing a truck. When the truck is purchased, George will work on transportation; he will get orders and will generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and start a transportation business.

texts.en:
Eric is 28 years old. He is single and has been in the farming business for the past four years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors to enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Saba is an 18-year-old, single woman from Deir el Balah. She lives with her family in a very simple house in the city. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Saba is a student in a local university, where she studies commerce. She dreams to take a BA degree and find a good job in the future. 

Saba took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, she will be able to easily write her homework and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
This is Kanze. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy coconuts for resale. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy 2 sacks of coconuts for resale. Her profit from her business will definitely help her provide for her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, and she lives in the West Point area.  She’s married, and her husband is teacher.  They have three children between 2 and 7 years, all at home and attending school. 

For the past ten years she has been involved in the sale of peppers, Irish potatoes, and onions. Her main challenge is low sales of goods during the raining season. What she like about this business is the exchange of goods for money. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more peppers, Irish potatoes, and onions. In future she‘ll like to be a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, Irish potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: Don Bruno es una persona muy alegre siempre esta de muy buen humor platica que tiene 50 años de edad vive en union libre con la señora Susana desde hace varios años y juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando. Don Bruno tiene un taxi el cual utiliza para trasporte publico desde hace 10 años cuenta que inicio su actividad porque no tenia un trabajo fijo muchas veces no tenia un sueldo fijo el cual no le asegura vivir sin preocupaciones economicas fue como decidio prestar sus servicios para el traporte publico. Don Bruno buscó apoyo en una empresa automotriz para que les pudieran apoyar con las placas de los taxis, sus peticiones tardaron cuatro años para que les pudieran dar sus concesiones y placas de sus actualmente Don Bruno tiene un taxi para su trabajo de todos los dias pero adicionalmente tiene otros autos los cuales son rentados a otras personas para que tambien tengan trabajo. Esta vez el señor Bruno esta solicitando el credito para poder liquidar un credito automotriz para el servicio de sus taxis, para Don Bruno es muy importante tener en buenas condiciones sus taxis esto le ayudara para mejorar su servios ya que la dificultad que presenta Don Bruno es la competencia. A pesar de ello, Don Bruno piensa trabajar con muchas ganas para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida le gustaria que sus hijos terminaran una carrera profesional. Este es su segundo ciclo solicitando un credito a KIVA y Vision Fund por el cual esta muy agradecido porque en algunos meses ha visto los grandes beneficios en el crecimiento de su clientela y ganancias.
texts.en: Don Bruno is a cheerful person who is always in a good mood. He is 50 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with Sra. Susana for many years. They have a family that includes four children, all of whom are studying. Don Bruno has a taxi that he offers as public transportation. He started this business 10 years ago because he did not have a steady job. There were many occasions in which his income was unpredictable, so he decided to provide public transportation services so that he could live without any financial worries. Don Bruno sought support from a formal company so that they help with with the license plates for his taxis. The negotiations took four years before he finally received his concessions and license plates for his taxis. Don Bruno currently has one taxi that he uses every day for his work, but he also has additional vehicles that he makes available for rent to help other people have a job. This time Don Bruno is requesting a loan in order to pay off a credit for the services of his taxis. For Don Bruno it is very important to have his taxis in good condition because it will help him improve his services and compete with the other taxis, which is the biggest difficulty he faces. Despite these challenges, Don Bruno is determined to work hard so that he can provide his children a better quality of life. He would like them to complete a professional degree. This is the second time he requests a loan through KIVA and Vision Fund and he is very grateful for it because in just a few months, he has seen his profit and clients increase together with the benefits this entails.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

location.town: San Cristobal de los Baños Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en:
Bavakan is from Gyumri town. She lives with her parents and sister. Bavakan is a cosmetologist with many years of experience. She provides manicure and make up services to locals from her house. Due to her hard work and good attitude toward people, Bavakan has many clients who prefer to use her service.

The income that Bavakan gets helps her cover family's basic needs and her personal needs. Currently, because of financial difficulties the family is facing, Bavakan needs to work more and gather higher income. She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new tools and equipment that she needs for providing cosmetology service. 

Bavakan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is greatly important for Bavakan to be able to provide a bigger variety of services to her clients, and gather income that is vital for her family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment needed for providing cosmetology service.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen has been involved in vehicle repair service for 4 years already. Near the house where he lives with his family, Arsen rents a small garage where he provides vehicle repair service. Arsen is a very hard working and an enthusiastic young man who does his best to provide better living conditions for his family. Arsen lives with his mother, brother, and sister, and their father is currently in Russia where he tries to find a job and sustain his family's living.

Arsen is running the vehicle repair business well enough as the income from the business helps him cover his family's basic needs. Now, to be able to change the old tools and equipment with new ones, Arsen needs financial support. He is asking for this loan to be able to purchase needed tools and equipment, and make his work more effective. 

Arsen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arsen and he hopes for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment needed for providing vehicle repair service.

loans.name: Marconey

texts.es: Marconey  tiene la edad de 55 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  sembrar frijoles y maíz  y un poco de tubérculos.   Tiene muchos años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Tiene un puesto en la feria del agricultor, donde vende sus productos directamente al consumidor por lo que los precios son mas bajos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ha realizado otros préstamos en una Cooperativa, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Marconey is 55 years old, married and has 3 children who are his main priority. He wants to plant beans corn and some tubers. He has many years experience working on his farm, Marconey wants his farm to expand and to be productive. He has a stall in the Farmer's Market where he sells his product directly to the public at a reasonable price.

This is the first loan Marconey has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had other loans with a cooperative but FUDECOSUR is offering him better terms and a lower interest rate. He wants to be able to give his children the education necessary so that in the future they are well prepared and ready to face life in the best manner possible.

loans.use: to plant basic seeds.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Chincha, para poder salir adelante y poder llevar un sustento para su hogar tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en su domicilio, Maria le dedica asu negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad y muy bonitos.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera poder atender a sus clientes de mejor manera y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Chincha. In order to get ahead and to support her household Maria has a small business out of her house where she sells clothing. Maria spends about 10 hours each day at her work and feels that it is going well for her. She is very friendly with her clients and moreover offers products of quality and that are beautiful.

Maria is thankful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their great support she can buy merchandise for her business. Then she can serve her customers better and continue to strive to fulfill her dream which is to "have her own store for her business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk,soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a hard-working woman who lives in the coastal part  of Kenya.

Peris has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Peris is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 27 años , está casada con Oscar y tiene un pequeño hijo con quien vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Se caracteriza por ser una madre muy abnegada y dedicada a su familia. Posee unas parcelas que heredo de sus padres por haber sido un gran apoyo desde niña. Lleva 8 años el rubro en donde produce con el apoyo de jornaleros cacao orgánico cuya demanda actual es muy buena.Comenta que le agrada su trabajo puesto que a su vez tiene la oportunidad de brindarles oportunidad laboral a otros jóvenes de su localidad. Por otro lado cuenta también con el apoyo económico de Oscar quien se desempeña como chofer de transporte en  rutas largas transportando pasajeros. A manera de bridar la mejor inversión para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos desea contar con dinero  y proceder con el primer deshierbo de campaña productiva que es muy indispensable para optimizar la producción final, así como la compra de abono orgánico. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 27 years old and is married to Oscar. She has a little boy and they live in their own house made of adobe. She is a very selfless mother who is dedicated to her family. She has some plots of land which she inherited from her parents as she was a great help to them from a young age. With the help of day labourers she has spent the last 8 years growing organic cocoa, which is in high demand at the moment. She says she likes her work as it also gives her the chance to provide work opportunities for other young people in her area. At the same time she gets financial support from Oscar who works as a driver on long distance passenger routes. 

In order to be able to invest effectively in her crop production she needs money so she can carry out the first weed clearance of the growing season, which is essential for getting a good crop, and she also wants to buy organic fertilizer. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting in order to make progress. She promises to pay her instalments punctually. On this occasion she wants to have 1000 nuevo soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 27 years old, married to Wycliffe, and she supports four members of her family. 

She runs a sukuma wiki (collard greens) business in Chepkumia, served  by Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last three years. The business generates an average monthly income of KES 5,000.

Hellen plans to use the amount borrowed, KES 20,000, to buy sukuma wiki to sell. She plans to reinvest the anticipated profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy sukuma wiki (collard greens) to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans appreciates his previous loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his barber shop business and earn a higher income.

Now, Evans is applying for a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase bottles of spirit, a mirror, powder and to repair his shaving machine. 

He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bottles of spirit, a mirror, powder and to repair his shaving machine

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en:
Edouard is 50 years old. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer during maize production in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 66 años, es viuda y madre de 3 hijos que ya mayores e independientes. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble, el cual construyo de a pocos con el fruto de su esfuerzo. Isidora se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Lleva 5 años con su establecimiento y hasta el momento ha logrado consolidarlo a base de esfuerzo como un buen sustento económico. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que le permitió hacerse muy conocida en su barrio y a su vez ganar muchas amistades. Dentro de los productos cuya demanda es mayor en su negocio están los víveres de primera necesidad así como  gaseosas y productos de limpieza personal para los cuales desea contar con capital de trabajo para surtir constantemente  su negocio con estos y demás mercadería. Su objetivo a largo plazo es el de culminar con el acabado del segundo piso de su vivienda e incursionar con el negocio del alquiler de cuartos para vivienda esperando de esta manera tener un ingreso fijo para su vejez. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio con la compra de productos al por mayor como es los sacos de arroz, azúcar, cereales; entre otros.
texts.en:
Isidora, 66, is a widow and mother of three grown, independent children. She lives in a house that she built over time with good materials. She has run her business for five years, and, through her efforts, it generates a good income. She is thankful that she is well known in her neighborhood and has made many friends because of her business. Basic groceries are most in demand in her store, along with sodas and personal care items. She needs working capital to keep these items and other merchandise in stock. 

Her long-term goal is to finish the second floor of her house and begin renting out rooms to provide a fixed income for her later years. This is her second loan cycle with the institution, and she is grateful for the chance to keep moving ahead. She wants to borrow 1,000 nuevo soles to increase her inventory and buy wholesale sacks of rice, sugar, cereal, and more.

loans.use: to buy food items like rice, sugar, and cereal.

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: Doña Rosa Adela, es una madre que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos,  en la actualidad uno depende económicamente de ella, Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, en su casa de habitación. Solicita el crédito para invertir en las mejoras de infraestructura de su hogar y principalmente en garantizar la salud de su familia, tiene la necesidad de instalar un servicio higiénico y construir un sumidero, ya que en donde habita no hay servicios de agua negras, con el financiamiento comprará materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, cemento, inodoros y sus accesorios, de esta manera su familia podrá tener mejores condiciones sanitarias en su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa Adela is a mother who worries about her children's well-being.  The children still depend on their mother financially.  Rosa makes a living selling clothes and footwear out of her home.  She is applying for this loan in order to improve her home and support her family's health: Rosa needs to install a toilet and drain as her home does not have a sewage system.  Rosa will use this loan to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, toilets and other plumbing items.  With this the family will have better sanitary conditions in the home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, toilets and other plumbing items.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and lives in the West Point area. She’s single and has four children between 2 months old and 15 years old. Only three of the children attended school and live at home.  

For the past nine years, Janet has been involved in the sales of vita, pepper, oil, and onions in the local market. Her main challenge is the increase in prices. 

Janet will use the money from the loan to buy more vita, pepper, oil, and onions. 

In the future, she wants to send all her children to good schools and to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy more vita, pepper, oil, and onions.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina de 26 años, estudio el nivel medio (bachillerato) en la ciudad, se graduó en el año 2005, tenía que viajar en bus todos los días, salía de su casa muy temprano por la mañana (5:30 am) para llegar a la hora indicada donde recibía las clases, durante todo el día.
Es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años de edad, quien ahora estudia en el kinder, procede de una familia de 5 hermanos, están dos en casa junto a la madre y las otras tres hermanas viven y trabajan en los estados Unidos, su padre murió en el conflicto armado que azoto al país en los años 80's.
Rosalina, trabaja fuertemente con su madre en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles), en el año 2010 trabajo por un periodo de dos años en la construcción de la carretera que pasa por la comunidad donde reside.
Solicita el crédito, para hacerle unos exámenes médicos a su hija, pues nació con problemas en el corazón (taquicardia) y arritmia respiratoria. Necesita hacerle unos exámenes a su hija valorados en $1,000, el resto lo necesita para los gastos que realizara en los viajes hasta la ciudad, pues tiene que visitar un hospital privado. Ella pretende ayudar a su pequeña niña para mejorar su salud, y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
El sueño Rosalina, es ver sana a su hija por completo, pues es ella por quien lucha día a día, para darle lo mejor de su vida y apoyarla en los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 26 years old and completed high school in the city in 2005.  She had to travel by bus every day, leaving her house at 5.30am in order to arrive on time.  She was there all day.

Rosalina is a single mother to a six-year-old girl, who is currently in nursery school.  Rosalina has four siblings - two live at home with their mother while her three sisters lives and work in the US.  Their father died in the armed conflict that so seriously harmed the country in the 1980s.

Rosalina works hard with her mother in farming (growing corn and beans).  In 2010, Rosalina started a two-year job building the main road that goes through her community.

Rosalina needs this loan to pay for some medical tests for her daughter who was born with heart problems (tachycardia) and arrhythmia.  She needs to pay for tests worth some $1000 and then Rosalina will use the rest of the loan to pay for the trips into the city as she has to go to a private hospital.  Rosalina plans to help her young daughter to improve her health and so that she can have a better quality of life.

Rosalina's dream is for her daughter to be completely healthy. Rosalina fights for her every day, to give her the best life and to support her in her education.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests for her daughter.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia y para poder salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas desde hace 2 años, asimismo para tener otro ingreso trabaja lavando autos y con ello puede tener un dinero extra para solventar los gastos de su familia ya que es madre de 2 hijos.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería como chocolates, caramelos, chizitos, entre otros para su negocio, de esta manera ella podrá atender mejor a los clientes seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un local propio y poder ser una gran distribuidora de golosinas”.
texts.en:
Maria is a happy and hard-working woman who lives in the city of Aguaytia. In order to get on in life she has had a small business selling sweets for the last 2 years and she also washes cars to earn additional income. By doing this she has extra money to cover the family's expenses, as she has 2 children. 

Maria is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help they have given her she will be able to buy more stock such as chocolates, sweets, puffed cheese snacks and other items for her business. By doing this she will be able to serve her customers better and carry on working towards making her dream a reality: to have her own premises and be a large distributor of sweets.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 32 years old.  He is married to a farmer, and they have three children. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old. He wants to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is 28 years old. He is married with two children. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: José, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Hace 1 año que se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ser ropa interior para damas y caballero, camisas, toallas,calcetas y sandalias. Esta mercadería la vende de manera ambulante. El prestamo que solicita es por 17,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la  compra de ropa como calcetas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros y sandalias, y poder ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes. El tiene como propósito hacer crecer el negocio para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante con al educación y lo que necesiten.
texts.en: José, 37, is married, has two children, and lives in Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. A year ago, he started selling clothing such as men's and women's underwear, shirts, towels, socks, and sandals as a street vendor. He has applied for a loan of 17,000 Lempiras to buy clothing like socks, men's and women's underwear, and sandals to offer his customers more variety.  His goal is to grow his business so that he can provide his children with an education and other necessities.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as socks, men's and women's underwear, and sandals.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 31 years old. He has been a farmer for the past five years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Ngano Group

texts.en:
Miriam, who is in her mid-twenties, is single, with a son in school. 

For three years now, Miriam has been running a retail shop selling items like juices, mosquito spray, air  time, cooking oil, dry food items, and other small  and quickly demanded products. She works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. per working day, and she is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock items in her shop, and she has managed to pay back all her previous loans successfully. She used her profit to buy a plot of land and pay school fees and household expenses. 

She is looking forward to improve much on her enterprise. Miriam will use this loan to rebuild her shop's inventories. She dreams to improve much her business and live a better life. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " NGANO, " which totals 13 members who hold each other accountable for paying aback the loan.

loans.use: to rebuild her shop's inventories.

loans.name: Eduwadi

texts.en:
Eduwadi is 32 years old.  He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 29 años, estudio segundo grado, se ha dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura, ayudante de albañil con su padre, trabajo durante dos años en una empresa de construcción, donde conoció a su esposa con quien ahora tiene un niño de 8 años de edad, estudia segundo grado en la comunidad, su esposa trabaja en la jarcia (elaboración de hamacas) y ayuda económicamente al hogar.
Su familia esta conformaba por sus padres y cinco hermanos, quienes están mayores de edad y trabajan en la agricultura y la albañilería.
Julio se dedica a elaborar hamacas de hilo de seda, desde hace ya 10 años, su esposa le enseño, debido a la demanda que hay en la zona y que le es rentable, también trabaja en la agricultura y diferentes oficios.
Antes trabajaba con su padre en la albañilería. Su esposa trabaja también tejiendo hamacas y tienen siete tejedores más,  a quienes le llevan el material y ellos pagan por la elaboración de las hamacas. El material lo compran en la comunidad, las venden en las comunidades del departamento y en otras ciudades.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 75 lbs de material para tejer hamacas,  guardacabos  y cortinas para las hamacas, el resto lo necesita para gastos en el hogar. Con ello pretende aumentar su volumen de producción y obtener mayores ingresos económicos, pues se acerca la temporada navideña y hay mayor demanda de los productos de artesanías.
Sueña seguir trabajando en las artesanías, darle el estudio a su hijo y también mejorar su vivienda, ahorrar poco a poco para aumentar su producción y tener más ofertas para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Julio only completed up to the end of second grade.  He has worked in agriculture and as a builder with his father. He also worked for a building company for two years - there he met his wife, with whom he now has an eight-year-old son.  Julio's son is in second grade and his wife makes hammocks and supports the household with this job.

Julio's family is made up of his parents and five siblings, all of whom are adults and working in farming and building.

Julio makes a living producing hammocks with silk threads.  He has been doing this for ten years, after having been taught by his wife.  Due to the high demand in the area, the business is profitable.  Julio also works in farming and does other jobs.

Previously Julio worked with his father in the building trade.  Julio's wife also makes hammocks, and has seven others who work with her.  They bring her material and then pay for her to make the hammocks.  They buy the material in the community and then sell the hammocks in various communities around the department, and in other cities.

Julio is applying for a loan in order to buy 75lbs of material to make hammocks, thimbles, and curtains for hammocks.  The rest will be used to cover household costs.  Julio plans to use the loan in order to increase production and earn a higher income.  Christmas is approaching and there is greater demand for artisan products.

Julio dreams of continuing to work in artisan handicrafts, of providing his son with an education, and also of improving his home.  He wants to save, little by little, in order to increase production and have more to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy 75lbs of material to make hammocks, thimbles, and curtains for hammocks.  The rest will be used to cover household costs.

loans.name: Gricelda Antonia

texts.es:
Gricelda vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, es madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, a la cual quiere muchísimo y ´por ello cada día se esfuerza mucho en su pequeño negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, ya que con el fruto de su humilde trabajo puede sacar adelante a su hija.

Gricelda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un pequeño terreno, ya que desea poder construir su viviendas,  y de esta manera mejor la calidad de vida de su hija”.
texts.en:
Gricelda lives in the city of Aguaytia. She has a little 2-year-old  daughter whom she loves very much and for this reason she works hard every day in her small business selling pork, so that with the earnings from her humble job she can bring up her daughter.

Gricelda is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy a small plot of land. She wants to be able to build her own home and so improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 51 años, es viuda y tiene  5 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de bloques de adobe. Desde muy niña creció junto a sus padres con quienes aprendió el oficio de la agricultura ligado a la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su región. Con el paso de los años y al cumplir la mayoría de edad optó al comprometerse conyugalmente en trabajar gracias a unas parcelas que fue heredado por sus progenitores  y seguir con el oficio familiar. Con el deceso de su esposo optó por continuar con su actividad apoyada por sus hijos mayores quienes consientes de la situación familiar vienen apoyando a su madre de manera abnegada, asimismo suele contratar a jornaleros  del lugar a quienes remunera por los trabajos de deshierbo y deschuponado de plantas que son algo dificultosas según comenta. Para continuar con el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones desea contar con capital para la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo. Este es  el segundo préstamo que solicita a Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo.
texts.en:
Paulina, 51, is a widow and has 5 children who live with her in her adobe brick house. From an early age Paulina grew up with her parents, who taught her farming and the production of organic cacao and other profitable products of the region. Over the years, when she became an adult and got married, Paulina chose to work thanks to some plots of land she inherited from her parents, and thus she carried on with the family business.
After her husband died, Paulina continued her work supported by her older children. They are conscious of the family situation and selflessly support their mother. Paulina also hires day laborers from the area. She pays them to weed and prune plants, which she says is a somewhat difficult activity.
To continue with the upkeep of her plantations, Paulina wants to have the resources to purchase organic manure and seedlings. This is the second loan she is requesting from Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support to keep moving forward. She also commits to making her payments in a timely fashion.
On this occasion, she is asking for 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy organic manure and seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras: papas, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papayas, güisquiles, entre otros,  tiene 5 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; él esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita poder mejorar su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, él quiere mejorar el terreno donde tiene su vivienda y poder construir unos cuartos para qué puedan vivir más cómodos toda la familia, por esa razon solicita el creito para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillos, etc. él esta agradecido con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He  sells fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, oranges, tomatoes, onion, chilies, papayas, chayote, etc. He has been in this business for 5 years. This gives him lots of experience in sales and allows him  to maximize his profits. The place where he sells is very strategic for his business and is very busy. He has lots of clients who prefer him. His product is fresh, well-priced, of good quality and comes with good service. 

Jose is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to improve his house as what he makes will not cover the cost of doing this. He wants to do some work on the plot where his house is and to add a few rooms so that his family can live in comfort. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy sand, cement, bricks, etc.  He is very pleased with the support and promises to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la compra y venta de fardos de tela desde hace varios años, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside  tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que tiene un su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para compra de mas fardos de tela por  mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y poder tener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
