texts.es: Lourdes, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Lourdes trabajo en un tiempo en una maquila y luego de quedar sin empleo estableció su propio negocio de venta de productos e la canasta básica como ser lácteos, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, churros, golosinas, etc. El negocio lo tiene desde hace 9 años y lo ha mantenido activo mediante varios prestamos.  El prestamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos de la canasta básica como carnes, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, pan, churros, refrescos, lácteos y otros, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 40 years old, is a single mother of 3 children, and lives in the Petoa municipality within the department of Santa Bárbara.  Lourdes used to work with machines but then found herself without work.  At that point, she started her own business selling basic groceries such as dairy products, sodas, meat, snacks, churros, candy, etc.

She has had her business for 9 years and has kept it going with the help of several loans.  The loan that she is asking for is for 21,000 lempiras.  She will use it to invest in buying more groceries such as meat, sugar, lard, beans, rice, bread, churros, soda, dairy products, and others.  In this way, she will increase her sales and help her business grow.

loans.use: buy basic grocery items such as meat, sugar, lard, beans, rice, bread, churros, soda, dairy products, and others.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 29 years old. She is married and lives at Pari-an, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she decided to raise pigs. 

Through PMPC, Leizel obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep conditions more sanitary.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 64 years old and lives in Balintawak, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with seven children.

Alicia has a buy and sell business and earns approximately PHP 25,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan to buy 50 bags of rice to sell.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand from her rice buy and sell business into different products.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Abita

texts.en:
Abita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000. This loan is intended to buy additional ingredients for ice cream making.
Abita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for ice cream making.

loans.name: Estariki

texts.en:
Estariki is 40 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has spent 12 years in maize production. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is 57 years old. He is a father of six children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine, aged 31, has four children and she has been in the farming business for the past three years. She would like to use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
Jean D’amour is 41 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story. She is a responsible person who believes in fulfilling her commitments. In the past she has had other loans funded by kiva and she has never failed making her payments.  Rita is a 41 year old entrepreneur who has been a merchant most of her life. She lives in Mexico City in a neighborhood called Iztapalapa. She sells cosmetics, gifts and other products and some years ago she started providing taxi services. Today she has several taxis.  

Rita has requested a loan to purchase merchandise such as cosmetics, purses and perfumes. Also she will be able to fix the engine of one of her taxis.  With the loan she will be able to deliver orders to her costumers on time and also increase her sales. Her biggest accomplishment in life is being a regional leader in catalog sales, and her main challenge is to buy more taxis. She is an innovative woman who thinks that with passion and hard work nothing is impossible.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and gifts that she sells through a catalog, and to fix a taxi that provides her with an additional source of income.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village in the Mtskheta district. Merab works physically. He gets orders to repair houses and gets a small income. This is the only source of income for his family. As the income is not stable, Merab decided to start a poultry business. He purchased 200 chicks and wants money to build a shed for them. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. As the chicks are raised, Merab will sell the hens and expand his farm. The Start Up loan will be a great help to his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a shed for his poultry

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Five years ago, Carlos decided to open his own construction business in Union City. Last year, his dream was realized and Carlos finally gained the permits and licensing to obtain his own contracts.

Carlos is already part of large network of contractors, having been working in the construction industry for 15 years. He is well known in the sector for having detailed work, and his good reputation allows Carlos to obtain contracts easily. 

Originally from Peru, Carlos manages four employees in the company. He and his wife are both entrepreneurial; she opened a restaurant this year and also provides jobs within the community. Together they are raising two children.

The nature of his work means Carlos gets paid quarterly. The funds from this loan will be used for working capital to pay for transportation, labor, and material costs for one of his projects. Carlos looks forward to growing the company and hiring more employees in the future.

loans.use: To pay for construction company’s transportation, labor, and material costs for one project

loans.name: Maria Orfelia

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, ella vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad muy comercial, se encuentra ubicada en una zona cálida húmeda del Ecuador, ciudad que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años porque es el puente entre las regiones costa y la sierra, tiene dos hijos, uno de 13 y una niña de 12, ellos estudian en colegio fiscal cerca de su casa. María hace 9 años por la necesidad y superación decidió crear por iniciativa propia su negocio. Ella compra chanchos en pie y vende su carne en un puestito ubicado en una vía principal de la ciudad, su negocio lo atiende cuatro días a la semana, los miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos, desde las 7 am hasta la 1 pm. Uno de sus obstáculos fue cuando recién empezó  y se quedó sin capital de trabajo debido a que dejaba fiando el producto a sus clientes, luego no pudo recuperar el dinero, pero esta experiencia le sirvió de mucho para no volver  a hacerlo. Ahora gracias a los ingresos de su negocio poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda e incluso adecuando cuartos para el arriendo. María conoció a Fundación Alternativa a través de vecinos quienes le recomendaron por los servicios que la institución ofrece, nos comenta que se siente muy agradecida porque ya lleva tres créditos y Fundación Alternativa le ha ayudado a mejorar mucho su calidad de vida, porque con estos créditos ella pudo mejorar sus ventas y mejorar su casa. Ahora el crédito que solicita es para comprar más cerdos pues en esta temporada la demanda crece y ella necesita abastecer las necesidades de sus clientes para así ganar una buena reputación en la ciudad.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, she lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a very commercial city found in a hot and humid area of Ecuador. It is a city which has grown a lot over the last few years because it is the bridge between the coastal regions and the mountain. 

María has two children, a 13-year-old boy and a 12-year-old girl, they study in the public school near her home. Nine years ago, through need and the desire to get ahead she decided to set up her business. She buys live pigs and sells the meat in a stall located in a main street of the city. She tends to the business four days a week: Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 7 am to 1 pm. One of the challenges she faced was when she had just set up and she was left with no working capital as she had left the product with her customers and was unable to recover the money later on. However, this experience was worthwhile in order to not repeat it. Now thank to her business' income, she has been improving her home little by little even fitting out rooms for rent.

María became aware of the Fundación Alternativa through neighbors who recommended it for the services that the institution offers. She tells us that she is very grateful as she has had three loans and the Fundación Alternativa has helped her very more improve her quality of life because she was able to improve her sales and improve her home through these loans. The loan that she is now seeking is to buy more pigs as in this season, demand grows and she needs to meet her customers' needs to therein gain a good reputation in the city.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif is a 29-year-old man. He is single and lives with his family--his parents and his elder brother. For 20 years his family have been IDPs (internally displaced persons) from their native land, Füzuli. Now they live in the Baku region. His mother, Durdana, is a housewife, his father, Mahammad, has been in the butcher business for 18 years, and his elder brother, Famil, is a taxi driver. Vagif has been in the consulting business for three years. He has a small office. He wants to buy a notebook computer, as he needs it for his business when he goes to another place. A notebook computer will be more useful and comfortable. Therefore he applied to Komak for a loan of 400 AZN. Vagif is thankful to Komak and the Kiva organization for the help. His business and monthly income will be increase. In the future he wants to have a new employee.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer for his consulting business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Edigard

texts.en:
Edigard is 56 years old. He is a father of eight and they all go to school. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, Edigard wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a young farmer from Arevatsag village of Lori region. She lives with her husband, one-year-old daughter, and elderly father-in-law. With the help of her family members, she is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and hens and the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and grass. Gohar's husband realizes the agricultural products in the local market. 

Agribusiness is the most important source of family's income. As the autumn is progressing, Gohar needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will support this young hard-working woman and her family greatly, enabling them to purchase some forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

With the help of the loan, the family will maintain and develop their agribusiness. Gohar and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is an experienced farmer from Vanadzor city of Lori region. She lives with her husband and school-aged son. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Ruzanna is engaged in cattle and pig breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of potatoes and apples. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As the autumn is progressing, Ruzanna’s agricultural business needs some investments to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase forage (hay and concentrated forage) for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it. However, thanks to their hard work in recent times, Ruzanna was able to run her farming business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Ruzanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ruzanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their farming business.

loans.use: to purchase forage (hay and concentrated forage) for their livestock

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Rachael is requesting KSHS 45,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Taneisha

texts.en:
Taneisha, a single mother of three children, has always dreamed of owning her own adult care facility. For fourteen years, she has worked in adult care homes, in addition to caring for her disabled child and uncle. Now, she looks to open her own adult care facility and utilize her experience and education. 

Taneisha has been preparing herself for years. She obtained her Certified Nurse’s Assistant certification (CNA), Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) certification, and several other periodic certifications, such as CPR certification and her Direct Support Professional (DSP) certification, to prepare to manage her own adult care facility. 

Taneisha never gave up on her dream. She has spent countless hours working on her business plan, attending training sessions and gathering information on how to properly operate an adult care facility. Taneisha was so passionate about her dream, she went out and rented a facility with the hope of obtaining financing to equip the facility with the proper furniture needed to operate. 

Taneisha will create two jobs with this project, one manager position and one assistant manager position. Her goals are to earn Vendor status, which allows her to have the maximum number of clients in her facility (4), and later, open a second location. A traditional bank would not consider doing this loan because it is a start-up. However, Fresno CDFI is stepping up to help Taneisha achieve her dream.

loans.use: to equip the adult care facility with the proper furniture needed to operate.

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.es:
Maria Rita es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Me llamo Rita y tengo 43 años, soy casada desde hace 24 años, tengo tres hijos y una nieta.
Me dedico a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 24 años. Me gustan las ventas y también me gusta bailar.
Solicitó el crédito para comprar mercancía de temporada ya que viene mi mejor epoca de ventas en el año. 
mi negocio es ventas por catalogo, como ya tengo 24 años vendiendo, mis clientes ya son todos conocidos y ellos me recomiendan con sus familiares y amigos , tengo una cartera de aproximadamente 100 clientes. Mis principales logro es haber ganado varios premios por tener ventas altas.
texts.en:
Maria Rita is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

My name is Rita and I am 43 years old. I have been married for 24 years and I have three children and one granddaughter. I have made a living selling cosmetics for 24 years. I like sales and I also like to dance.

I requested this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise as the best sales period of the year is coming up. My business is composed of catalog sales and as I have been making sales for 24 years, I know all of my customers and they recommend me to their friends and relatives. I have a portfolio of approximately 100 customers. My main achievement is having won several awards for high numbers of sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
Eldard is a married man, age 31 years, and with 4 children; three of whom attend different schools. He lives in a rural trading center with his family, and deals in agricultural produce business where he purchases coffee, beans, and maize. He also has a retail shop, which he considers as his side business, and he started his business in 2005.

He works 6 days in a week and 10 hours a day. He started this business to get money to cater for his family and improve his standard of living. He acquired this loan to purchase more produce for the business. He said that his clients are traders from Kyotera.

His dream is to enlarge his business and be the leading supplier of produce in his trading center. The challenges he faces are price fluctuations and lack of enough market for the produce. He describes himself as an honest man and encourages lenders to give clients the amount of money they apply for to enable them meet their targets.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce.

loans.name: Benonson

texts.en: Benonson, a married man, lives in a rural area with his family. He is an agriculturalist who does animal rearing and farming on a small scale. He needs a loan to buy baby goats that he will rear and later sell at an increased price. If he has enough money, he will acquire them cheaply, which is the reason he has requested the loan. He is optimistic that the business will make a lot of profits, and will eventually expand it to cattle. He is hard working and resilient. He is challenged by the dry seasons, and limited capital.

loans.use: to buy baby goats that he will rear and later sell at an increased price.

loans.name: Kyembare Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en: Kyembare Group consists only of women whose major activity is farming, a few of whom are engaged in cattle rearing They applied for loan of UGX 3,200,000. They will divide this money among themselves. They face a challenge of low productivity of their farming businesses due to poor farming methods, price fluctuations, and foot and mouth disease. Their prime target is to obtain high output from their plantings, to have more milk from their cows, and to take their children to better schools in the country. But they are short of capital and funds to enable them achieve their dreams. With this loan, they believe their production will improve and their life style will change in society. Jane will use her loan to buy seeds for planting. She is thankful for the financial support that Ugafode gives her group.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Soy Estela y soy casada, tengo 3 hijos de los cuales 2 viven aún conmigo.  Vivo en casa propia y tengo mi negocio de venta de ropa. 

Tengo mi puesto de ropa en un tianguis desde hace 6 años, en el cual tengo ropa para toda la familia. Quiero este préstamo para invertir en mi negocio y tener más variedad en la mercancía que ofrezco. 

Gracias a mi negocio he logrado sacar a mis hijos adelante, y mi reto es poder seguir adelante con él y hacerlo crecer más.
texts.en:
Estela is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

I am Estela and I am married and have 3 children, 2 of which still live sith me. I  live in my own home and I have a business selling clothing.

I have had my clothing stall, located in a street market, for 6 years. There I sell clothing for the whole family. I want this loan to invest in my business and have a greater variety of merchandise to offer. 

Thanks to my business I have been able to get my children ahead. My challenge is to continue to succeed with my business and make it grow more.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of clothing to offer more products

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia
Hola me llamo Marcela pero me gusta que me digan “Susu” y vivo en casa propia con mi hija que me ayuda en mi negocio cuando lo necesito.
Tengo 67 años, desde hace 15 años puse una tiendita que está ubicada en mi domicilio; ahí vendo abarrotes, refrescos y todo tipo de alimentos. Además vendo productos para la salud como vitaminas y suplementos alimenticios. 
Pido este préstamo para poder surtir más mi negocio y tener más mercancía que ofrecer, así como tener más productos de Omnilife y Lebasi para mis clientes.
Lo que he podido lograr con mi negocio es ir haciendo mejoras a mi casa, antes era de lámina y logre poner la loza. Quiero seguir mejorando mi casa y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Marcela is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

“Hi, my name is Marcela, but I like to be called “Susu”.  I live in my own house with my daughter.  She helps me in my business when I need it.

I am 67 years old, and 15 years ago I set up a small store in my house.  I sell groceries, soft drinks, and all types of food.  I also sell health products like vitamins and food supplements.

I am requesting this loan in order to be able to stock my business more and to have more merchandise to sell.  This way I will have more products like Omnilife and Lebasi for my customers.

What I have been able to achieve with my business is to make improvements to my house.  Before there was metal sheeting, and I managed to put in the tile.  I want to continue improving my house and making my business grow.”

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and food stuffs to offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Hola me llamo Teresa tengo 50 años y estoy casada. Tengo dos hijos que ya son independientes, mi hija me apoya económicamente.
Me dedico a la fabricación de ropa interior para dama y caballero desde hace 20 años. Mis ventas son por mayoreo en un tianguis. 
Voy a utilizar el crédito para comprar tela en rollo, al comprar tela por mayoreo puedo obtener mayor ganancia. 
Tengo un taller de costura en la parte superior de mi casa. Mi negocio es familiar trabajo con mis papas y hermanos. Mis principales logros es darle una Buena calidad de vida a mi familia, tener una casa propia y lograr que mi negocio crezca. 
Teresa ha demostrado ser una clienta cumplida, ya que pago puntualmente un crédito anterior con Kubo Financiero.
texts.en:
Teresa is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

“Hi, my name is Teresa.  I am 50 years old, and I am married.  I have two children who are now independent.  My daughter supports me financially.

I have been making women’s and men’s underwear for 20 years.  I make my sales for wholesale at a market.

I am going to use the loan to buy rolls of fabric.  By purchasing fabric wholesale, I am able to get greater profits.

I have a seamstress shop in the upper part of my house.  My business is a family business; I work with my parents and siblings.  My main achievements are giving my family a good quality of life, having my own home, and managing to have my business grow.”

Teresa has shown herself to be a reliable client.  She punctually paid a previous loan with Kubo Financiero.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale in order to improve profit

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Soy recién casado, estudiante de Odontología en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.  Me encuentro en la última etapa de mi carrera. 
Llevo dos años trabajando en un consultorio particular donde trabajo con un compañero; buscamos hacerlo crecer hasta formar una clínica dental. Aquí realizo odontología integral, operatoria dental, resina, amalgama, prótesis fija y removible, extracciones, cirugía bucal, endodoncias, ortopedia, coronas en acero, cromo y estéticas, etc.
Solicitó el crédito para poder ampliar mi consultorio, pensamos comprar otro sillón dental para que los dos podamos trabajar simultáneamente.
Entre mis logros están: haber sido el segundo mejor promedio de mi clase, haber pagado mi boda y amueblado mi casa.  Mi reto es tener una clínica dental con todas las especialidades.
texts.en:
Sergio is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

“I am recently married and a dentistry student at Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.  I am in the final stages of earning my degree.  I have been working at a private practice along with a partner.  We are looking to grow the business until it becomes a dental clinic.  I provide comprehensive dentistry, dental surgery, fillings (resins and amalgam), fixed and removable prosthetics, extractions, oral surgery, endodontics, orthopedics, crowns (steel and chrome), aesthetic procedures, and other services.  

I am requesting a loan so that I can expand my practice.  I plan to buy another dental chair so that my partner and I can work simultaneously.  Among my accomplishments are having the second best average in my class, being able to pay for my wedding, and furnishing my house.  My goal is to have a dental clinic that offers all specialties.”

loans.use: to buy a dental chair.

loans.name: Lucía Cipriana

texts.es:
Lucía es clienta de Kubo Financiera y esta es su historia:

Mi nombre es Lucia, vivo en unión libre desde hace 16 años y tengo hijos de 15, 12 y 10 años. Hace 8 años iniciamos mi esposo y yo este negocio en el cual hacemos uniformes principalmente además de blusas, entre otras prendas que nos piden.

Empezamos haciendo 5 uniformes y al ponerlos en venta empezaron a encargarnos más, luego ya eran 100 y así fue que decidimos ofrecer el servicio a varias escuelas y algunas tiendas de ropa. Tengo 2 empleadas en mi taller y damos a maquilar a 8 empleadas en Tula, Hidalgo. 

Este préstamo lo pido para comprar tela ya que tengo un pedido de blusas y para hacer algunos uniformes; me gusta ser buena pagadora y cuido mucho mis créditos para siempre tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Lucía is a client of Kubo Financiera and this is her story:

My name is Lucy. I have been in a common-law relationship for 16 years and have children ages 15, 12 and 10.  Eight years ago my husband and I started this business in which we mainly make uniforms, as well as blouses and other articles of clothing that we are asked for. 

We began making five uniforms, and when we put them on sale, people began to order more from us; then there were 100 and this was how we decided to offer this service to several schools and to some clothing stores. I have two employees in my workshop and contract out to eight employees in Tula, Hidalgo.

I am asking for this loan to buy fabric, as I have an order for blouses and for some uniforms. I like to pay on time and I'm very careful with my loans so that I can always stay in business.

loans.use: To buy fabric needed to fullfill orders

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is a 26-year-old married man with one son. Elman is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chicken and duck, which brings him a stable income. Elman is a very hardworking man. For the past three years, he has been raising chickens and ducks and is very active in poultry. He usually buys small ducks, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His father helps him in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business, Elman's monthly income is 120 AZN. He has applied for his first loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue

loans.use: to buy more small chickens

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 44 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 46. He is the father of five children. He has spent many years in maize production, and he plans to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Abdul Aziz

texts.en:
Abdul-Aziz is married and has spent one year in maize production. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es: Evelia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Petoa,Santa Bárbara. Hace 1 año que ella decidió establecer su propio negocio, tiene a la venta productos de la canasta básica como ser refrescos, embutidos, carnes, churros, sal, café, condimentos, manteca, harina, arroz y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos para la venta como refrescos, churros, embutidos, harina, carne y lácteos y así poder aumentar sus ventar y obtener mayor ganancia. Ella piensa en un futuro construir su propio local para el negocio.
texts.en:
Evelia is 45 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Bárbara.  It has been one year since she decided to start her own business.  She sells basic needs items such as soft drinks, cold cuts, meats, chips, salt, coffee, condiments, shortening, flour, rice and others.

The loan she has applied for is for 6,000 Lempiras, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of more products to sell, such as soft drinks, chips, cold cuts, flour, meat and dairy products, so that she can increase her sales and earn a better income.  In the future, she would like to build her own store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as meats, soft drinks, cold cuts, chips, flour and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 60s, is married with seven children; only two are still in school and the rest are grown-ups. She has been running several businesses, including selling chicken eggs, pork, and clothes door to door. She has been in her businesses for ten years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Regina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more chicks to raise and then sell their eggs, more pigs to slaughter and sell the meat (pork), and clothes to sell from door to door. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to buy a fridge, pay college fees for the two children who are still studying, renovated her house which was leaking, and cover household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy 500 chicks and chicken feed for feeding chickens in order to sell their eggs. She dreams of building a shop for her businesses.

Regina will share this loan with her loan group, Saadani, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 500 chicks and chicken feed for feeding chickens in order to sell their eggs.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad  vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Maria solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 34, lives in the family house with her husband and their four children.  She has been selling tortillas at her house for ten years.  She works from Mondays through Sundays.  She has a lot of clientele.  She is a very hard-working and kind person.  With the income that she gets, and with help from her husband, they manage to pay for their household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is one hundred pounds] in order to continue making the tortillas.  This way she will get improved profits in order to have better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is one hundred pounds] and lime powder.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine  fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 44 ans et est marié à  Joseph,  un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de beignets depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine  pour la préparation de beaucoup de beignets   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, il assure les besoins fondamentaux de sa famille (alimentation, logement et les soins de santé) et il a déjà acheté un porc.
texts.en:
Séraphine is a member of the Abadahemuka group and lives in Gitega. She is 44 years old and married to Joseph, a mason. Together they have 3 children.

Séraphine has been in the pastry business for 6 years. She is on her sixteenth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she obtains, she will increase her business capital and purchase flour in bulk, in order to prepare pastries for resale and increase her earnings. With the profits from her business, Séraphine takes care of her family's fundamental needs (food, housing, and health needs) and she has already been able to purchase a pig.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase flour in bulk to be able to prepare pastries for resale and increase her profits

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, necesita comprar herbicidas, insecticidas, abono y pagara mozos para sembrar, para que su producción sea buena, con el préstamo que se le dio antes el sembró sin ningún problema, aumento sus ganancias, la cosecha fue abundante y las condiciones familiares son diferentes.
Su familia sigue estable, está compuesta con el mismo número de personas, siguen muy saludables y dispuestos a seguir apoyándolo.
texts.en:
Felipe needs to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer and to pay workers to plant.  He needs to do this so that he gets a good production.  With the previous loan he planted without any problem, increased his profits, got an abundant harvest, and his family conditions have changed.

His family continues to be stable.  It is comprised of the same number of people.  They continue to be healthy, and they are prepared to continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer and to pay workers to plant.

loans.name: Twumvikana Group

texts.fr:
Elodie fait partie du groupe Twumvikane  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 51ans et est mariée à  Hassan,  un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 13 à 18, tous étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de pagnes depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de pagnes    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elodie is a member of the Twumvikane group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 51 years old and is married to Hassan, a teacher. Together they have 4 children ages 13 to 18, all of whom attend school. She has been selling "pagne" cloth for 7 years and is on her seventh loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that she receives, Elodie will increase her business capital and purchase "pagne" cloth in bulk, in order to increase her earnings. In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase "pagne" cloth in bulk for resale to increase her earnings

loans.name: Xayala

texts.en: Xayala is a 32 year old married woman and is the mother of two children She is an IDP (internally displaced person). She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. Xayala is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working every day without rest. She bakes bread daily and takes it to the market daily. Her breads are very famous because they are made in a traditional style which involves cooking them in special ovens. Her profit from this business is 150 AZN. Xayala is opting for a loan of 1900 AZN because she needs more working capital in order to continue investing in her business. This investment will help her to buy raw materials for making bread, such as flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, and more. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes de hombre y mujeres, shampoo, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Maria desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes ,etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, age 46, sells all types of personal use items like lotions, deodorants, creams, men’s and women’s perfumes, and shampoo, etc.  Her business is located at her house.  With the profits that she gets from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to pay their household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.

Maria wishes to expand her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy everything needed like perfumes, nail polish, and deodorants, etc.  She has a lot of clientele because she sells her products at affordable prices.

With the requested help she will be able to get improved profits.  This way she will continue giving her family what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, and deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 32 years old. He is married, with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, Saidi wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Burikhon

texts.ru:
Бурихон 23-летний холостой молодой человек. Он со своей семьей живет в селе района Хамадони. Он около 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Бурихон откармливает маленьких бычков, и после того как они набирают достаточный вес, продает их на скотном рынке. Бурихон с ранних лет работал на скотном дворе и по сей день там же проводит свое время. Кормить, поить и ухаживать за скотами вошло в привычку. 
   Бурихон просит кредит, чтобы закупить бычков и пополнить количество поголовья скота на скотном дворе.
texts.en:
Burikhon is a 23 years old, single, young man. He lives with his family in the Hamadoni region. He has worked with cattle breeding for more than 10 years. Burikhon fattens small bull-calves, and after they have gained enough weight, sells them at the livestock market. 

Since his early years, Burikhon worked at the cattle-yard and to this day this is where he spends his time. Feeding, giving water to and caring for the cattle has become a habit. Burikhon requests a loan to purchase bull-calves and increase the number of cattle in the cattle-yard.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She owns a shop in which she sells convenience store items, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and snacks, among other things. She has been running this business for many years and thus has a lot of experience in sales which allows her to do well. The business is located in her house, which in turn is located in a busy area. Maria has a lot of clients since she has a well stocked shop; people prefer her to the competition as she always has what they need at good quality, good prices, and excellent service. 

Like any good businessperson, Maria wants to grow her business and make an investment. She is therefore requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. Maria has good credit and assures that she will pay off the loan. She hopes that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Haykaz

texts.en:
Haykaz is a young private entrepreneur from Vanadzor city of Lori region. He lives with his mother and brother. His mother and brother are employed in the private sector. All family members work hard to earn a living. To take care of his family, Haykaz runs a small local retail shop for shoes. It has already been about two years since Haykaz started his small business, which is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue developing his small business, Haykaz needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase a car. The latter will help him organize his business in a more efficient way. Haykaz and his family members will highly appreciate the lenders support, and will be thankful to them for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is from the Odzun village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband (in the photo) and three sons. Her sons are currently labor migrants in Russia; they work there and send some money to their parents to take care of their needs. Maya is a teacher in the village local school. Her salary is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that alone. With the help of her husband, Maya is engaged in beekeeping; breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, and hens; and cultivating wheat, sunflower, grass, and strawberries. Maya's husband realizes the agricultural products are a very important source of income for them. Their honey has a very high demand in the local market. To sustain and develop their agribusiness, Maya needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase twenty beehives. As this is Maya’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Maya and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase twenty beehives.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом порядочная женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Гуландом более 10 лет работает в доме инвалидов. Она работает поваром. Она всегда мечтала, чтобы один из ее детей стал врачом. Гуландом отправила старшего сына за границу, чтобы учится. Данное время ее сын учится на 1 курсе Чувашского государственного университета. Он учится по специальности лечебное дело. Гуландом мечтает, чтобы ее второй сын стал лётчиком. Двое ее детей учатся в средней школе. Гуландом запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulandom is a respectable woman. She is 38 years old. She is married and raising three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Gulandom has worked in a nursing home for more than 10 years. She works as a cook. 

Gulandom always dreamed about one of her children becoming a doctor. She sent her eldest son abroad to study. Currently her son is in the first year of the Chuvash State University. He specializes in medical studies. Gulandom dreams of her second son becoming a pilot. Two of her children go to secondary school. 

Gulandom requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar to pay for her son's tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчон родился в 1952 года в сельской местности. Он с детства всегда мечтал стать врачом. Комилчон осуществил свою мечту. Он более 38 лет работает врачом в больнице своего района. Комилчон женат. Ее жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Они имеют 3 детей. Его сын учится в Медицинском Университете в Российской Федерации. Комилчон очень рад, что его сын выбрал его профессию. Комилчон запрашивает займ на сумму 2250 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии оплатить за учебу сына. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Komiljon was born in 1952 in a village. Since childhood he dreamed of becoming a doctor. Komiljon realized his dream. He has worked as a doctor at a hospital in his region for more than 38 years. 

Komiljon is married. His wife works as a nurse at the hospital. They have three children. Their son studies at a Medical University in the Russian Federation. Komiljon is very happy that his son chose the same profession as him. 

Komiljon requests a loan in the amount of 2,250 US dollar to pay his son's tuition. He has a small pay and is not in a situation where he can pay for his son's education. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Marcerine

texts.en:
Marcerine is married with seven children. She would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to use for maize production; she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenarge, invierte en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que es una actividad que ejerce desde hace mucho tiempo y le genera los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante, en está ocasión necesita comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, para preparar el terreno donde sembrara. Anteriormente él invirtió y tuvo una cosecha muy abundante y de buena calidad, cumplió con las necesidades de sus clientes a tiempo.
Como su economía mejoro notablemente pudo ampliar su vivienda y darle apoyo a su hija en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Buenerge earns a living by growing corn and beans. He has been doing this for a long time and it provides him with enough income to get ahead. 

This time around, he needs to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides to preparing the land for sowing. 

His previous loan allowed him to have an abundant and high-quality crop, and he was able to fulfill his clients' requests on time. Since his economic situation increased notably, he was able to expand his home, and support his daughter in her studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is a private entrepreneur from the village Ayntap of Ararat region. She lives with her daughter and two sons. Seda's daughter works in the postal service, and her sons are employed in the private sector. All the family members put their efforts together to be able to earn a living. 

Seda runs a small local store where she sells different grocery products and household goods of daily demand. The assortment of goods she sells in the store is not that big. It needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to develop in a sustainable way. 

Seda currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase new items to resell in her store. With the help of the loan, her small store will become more compatible. Seda and her family members will highly appreciate the lenders support, and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase new items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
A hardworking and enterprising woman, Karen, who lives in the coastal region of Kenya, operates a chemist shop. In business for the past two years, she says that price fluctuations are her major challenge. 

With this Kshs 25,000 loan, Karen wants to purchase antibiotics and other medicines for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase antibiotics and other medicines for resale

loans.name: Erjanik

texts.en:
Erjanik is an experienced farmer from Haykadzor village of the Shirak region. She lives with her husband, son, and two daughters. With the help of her family, Erjanik is extensively involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of sheep, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat. Her husband and sons sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. 

As the autumn is progressing Erjanik needs to buy a supply of forage for the livestock. She needs a loan of  $2,000 to purchase the forage. The loan will help the family prepare their agribusiness for the winter. As this is Erjanik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Erjanik and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for the good will and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her livestock

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 39 years old and lives in the village of Chao with his wife and two school-age children. He leads the family agricultural business and breeds two cows. He takes good care of his livestock and sells the received milk locally. As well, Ramaz grows potatoes, maize and walnut trees on his own plot of land. 

Their existing income is not enough for a family of four. With this start-up loan, Ramaz will purchase a truck and start his own transportation business. He will carry and transport a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers. As he has the appropriate experience in this field, Ramaz hopes his project will be be successful and lucrative. Ramaz would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to start a transportation business.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 33 years old. He is married with one child aged one. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during rice production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilzers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 45 years old. He is married with three children. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Mehrali

texts.en:
Mehrali is 20 years of age and is a young client. Mehrali is an IDP person (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with his parents. He is a very positive and hardworking man. 

Mehrali is a merchant; he is selling mixed goods such as toys, household goods, perfumes and jewelry. He has two years experience in this business. 

As you can see from the photo, there are very few goods in his store because he does not have enough funds to buy goods. Even though it’s a small business, he has a lot of customers. Considering the customers’ demand, Mehrali wants to expand his business. For this reason he is applying for a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy new perfumes, toys and household goods for his store. He is very optimistic about this business and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new perfumes toys and household goods for his store.

loans.name: Eldeniz

texts.en:
Eldeniz is 24 year old young client from Bilasuvar. He is not married. Eldeniz is an IDP person (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with his parents. After several attempts to find a job he decided to start his own business. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years. He also breeds cattle.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. Eldeniz sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise the crops.

As his products are in high demand, he  wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Doña concepción de 60 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Concepción es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, agujas,  etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Concepción, 60, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.  She's an incredible and very exemplary woman because she's hardworking, responsible, and positive.  Many people highly recommend her and her work.

Concepción earns a living making clothing.  Her business is located in her house.  She makes a variety of garments at very affordable prices.  Her work is also high quality, which is why many people prefer her.  She has done this work for many years, so she has a lot of experience and steady customers who prefer her.

Concepción decided to request this loan from Integral to invest in her small business and buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, and other supplies so she can make a variety of garments.

She's doing this to give her customers better service so they're motivated to keep on requesting her services and so her sales and income will grow.  She hopes to realize her goal and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres issus du même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve au milieu de la photo et levant le bras ,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 30ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont  un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce du mil et du maïs,elle affirme qu'elle posséde une bonne expérience par rapport à son activité.

Avec le prêt reçu,elle compte acheter du maïs pour une valeur de 30000f et de l'arachide pour une valeur de 20000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was created in December 2009. It is made up of members from the same village. They make money through small business and agriculture. The one who is in the middle of the photo raising her hand is the leader of the group. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children, of which one is a boy. She makes money through the sale of millet and corn. She can confirm that she possesses good experience vis-a-vis her business. With the loan she receives, she expects to buy corn at a value of 30,000 f and peanuts at a value of 20,000 f. Her objective is to increase her savings and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase corn and peanuts.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is a private entrepreneur from Kapan city. She lives with her husband, nine-year-old daughter and five-year-old son. Lala's husband works as a car mechanic. To assist her husband in earning a living, Lala runs a small local shop, where she sells clothes and shoes. The assortment of goods she sells in her store is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to develop and function in a productive way. 

Lala needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase new items (clothes and shoes) to resell in her store. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Lala was able to run her small business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Lala and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase new items (clothes and shoes) to resell in her store.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old. He has requested this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase his production of rice. Vincent wishes to reinvest profits into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 36 years old, a female and married. She has five children 18,16,14,12 and five years old who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer and she has a canteen. She has been in this business for thirteen years; it is located at Gongoni. 

In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 13,050. She is taking his fourth loan of KES 40,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her  business by adding stocks of milk, bread, sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, soft drinks, cooking oil and rice. Her previous loan of KES 30,000 was paid back successfully.

Khadija  will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it into a wholesale shop. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to open another business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase milk, bread, sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, soft drinks, cooking oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 31 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 61 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is from Sisian city, Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and works as a music teacher. Her salary, however, is not enough to cover her family's basic needs. With the help of her husband she is engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes, apples, pears, and walnuts. Margarit's husband helps her greatly in selling the agricultural products in the local market. 

As life is getting more expensive with time, Margarit wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to more effectively meet her family's needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman enabling her to purchase a cow, two calves, and four piglets, to buy forage for the livestock and to purchase some fuel for agricultural machinery. 

As this is Margarit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good-will and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, two calves, and four piglets, to buy forage for the livestock and to purchase some fuel for agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 23-year-old single Palestinian refugee, working and living in a Palestinian Camp with limited access to several living and working sectors.

Jalal is well known in his region and has a good reputation for the hard work he has done to develop his living standards and his business with the aim of improving his socioeconomic situation. Four years ago, he opened his own internet cafe, where most of the camps' teenagers and citizens come and spend a joyful time with each other, since it is a major sector for entertainment in a place that lacks such similar things.

Jalal is a acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to do the necessary maintenance on his business equipment, to keep his business up to date. He'll also use part of the loan to do necessary maintenance on his car, which he uses to buy requested equipment from outside the camp and the nearby villages.

He hopes that in the future, he'll be capable of opening a wider business outside the camp and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his business equipment.

loans.name: Raul Ignacio

texts.es:
