Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 49 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have six children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Micheal is a man of 43 years. He is married to Jane and a father of three lovely children. He runs a shop for making DVDs in Kangemi. He has been in this business for 11 years and gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Micheal's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy equipment for making DVDs. He wants to educate his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy electronic equipment for making DVDs.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 57 years old. He is a father of four children, and they all attend school. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin, 46, is a father of six. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during his maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kolala

texts.en:
Kolala has a cereals shop in Emali town. She sells beans, maize and rice among other cereals. She is 63 years old, widowed and blessed with 10 children. She has been in this business for the last six years, and it has been profitable. Right now her monthly income is 9,000 KES [Kenyan shillings].

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include maize and beans. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Kolala hopes to grow her business, make more income and be able to educate her children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Reachel

texts.en: 36-year-old Reachel operates a shop selling charcoal in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.  She is married and has 4 children, aged between 5 and 17.  They are currently attending school and live at home.  She does not know how to read and write but she manages her business well.  She describes herself as a good businesswoman. Reachel works for 8 hours each day of the week at her business.  Her greatest challenge is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She started her business to help from her husband.  She likes her business because that's where she gets some money for her expenses.  In the future, she wants to own a house. She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada is 34 years old, single and living in the southern part of Kosovo with her entire family. For the last 10 years, she has been making and selling handicraft items, operating from a small store at her home. She has a lot of customers and orders for her work, allowing her to generate enough money to be the main source of income for her family. 

She is very committed to her work and her customers and takes pride and great efforts to be successful. At this time she is requesting a loan from KosInvest in order to purchase work materials for her items in order to improve her business and generate higher income. Senada’s goal is to expand her business and hire an employee to work for her in the near future and be able to get married and have her own family. Knowing that it is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase work materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en: Danijela is the mother of four children between the ages of 18 and 24 years old and lives in a small minority community in Kosovo. While her husband receives a pension, Danijela works in a primary school doing administration work. In order to increase their income, she and her husband also have worked in agriculture for a long time, based on family tradition. They own cows and pigs, as well as plant corn and wheat on their land. Danijela uses the cow’s milk for her family and also sells the milk and other dairy products in her neighborhood. She is a very hard worker who wants to have a better life for her family and is therefore requesting a loan to expand her stable and eventually increase the number of cows and pigs she owns. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her stable

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru: Исмат 26 летний женатый молодой человек. Он живет в районе Мастчох города Худжанд с женой, двумя дочерьми, родителями, братом и тремя сестрами. Исмат имеет высшее экономическое образование и работает в банке. Его отец работает продавцом в магазине, а мать занимается разведением скота. Единственный брат Исмата является студентом. Он в этом году поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет "Финансы и кредит". В будущем он хочет стать хорошим специалистом как его старший брат. Учеба в университете началась несколько месяцев назад, но за контракт их семья все еще не оплатила. Исмат хочет помочь брату и оплатить за его первый год обучения. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом. Исмат берет обязательства по кредиту на себя и обещает в срок выплачивать кредит за счет свей работы.
texts.en: Ismat is a 26 year old married young man. He lives in the region of Mastchokh in the town of Khujand with his wife, two daughters, parents, his brother and three sisters. Ismat has a higher education in economics and works in a bank. His father works as a sales person in a store and mother breeds cattle. Ismat's only brother is a student. This year he has enrolled in a Khujand State University majoring in Finance and Credit. In the future he wants to become a professional as his brother. Classes at the university started a few months ago, but the family has not yet paid for the tuition. Ismat wants to help his brother and pay for his first year of study. He has come to ask for a loan with this purpose. Ismat is taking on a responsibility for the loan and promises to pay off in time using his job income.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's first year tuition.

loans.name: Mayra Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra se encuentra desde hacer 4 años en el grupo de crédito Medio Ejido, le gusta este tipo de créditos por la unión, solidaridad y compañerismo de todas las socias, además de que en cada reunión se divierten mucho con el carisma de cada integrante. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que esta bañada por 4 ríos, cuenta con carios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro histórico aun guarda celosamente su historia, su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, laboran en diferentes actividades y aun guardan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Mayra tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 6 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
A Doña Mayra le gusta cocinar y preparar los platos típicos de su tierra, en su negocio se encuentra algunos años en el cual labora de lunes a viernes, iniciando su jornada desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir para la compra de víveres, vajilla y ollas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra has been a member of the communal bank "Medio Ejido" for four years.  She likes this type of credit because of the union, solidarity and comradeship of all the members.  Plus, in every meeting they have a great time because of each member's charisma.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that is bathed by four rivers and which has many places to enjoy nature.  Its historic center jealously preserves its history and the local people, like the members of the communal bank, struggle daily to improve their household economy.  They work in different businesses and maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Mayra, 40, is married and has a six-year-old son who goes to the city school.  Her husband is a truck driver and they rent the house they live in.

Mayra enjoys cooking and prepares the typical dishes of her country.  She has been running a food business for several years and works Monday through Friday.  Her work schedule is from 3:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy food, dishes and pots and pans.  Her dream is to have her own home one day.

loans.use: To buy food, dishes and pots and pans.

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Medio Ejido, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que esta bañada por 4 ríos, cuenta con carios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro histórico aun guarda celosamente su historia, su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, laboran en diferentes actividades y aun guardan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Le gusta este tipo de créditos por la unión que hay entre todas las socias, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le ayudan a mejorar la estabilidad de su negocio.
La Señora Martha tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están en el colegio y dos últimos en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión joyero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Martha pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa por lo que le ayuda en el negocio a su esposo, al mismo tiempo que esta con sus hijos y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a founding member of the communal bank "Medio Ejido".  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that is bathed by four rivers and which has many places to enjoy nature.  Its historic center jealously preserves its history and the local people, like the members of the communal bank, struggle daily to improve their household economy.  Thye work in different businesses and maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Martha, 32, is married and has four children, ages 15, 13, 10 and 6.  Her two eldest attend middle school and the youngest two go to the city elementary school.  Her husband is a jeweler by profession.  They rent the house they live in.

Martha spends most of her time at home helping her husband run his business.  She also cares for the children and in her spare time sells clothing by catalogue.

She will use the loan to buy clothing.  Her dream is to have her own house one day and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y los quiere muchísimo y por ello con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar una mototaxi, la cual alquila para poder tener ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar, asimismo trabaja en la municipalidad de su distrito en el área de mantenimiento de parques y jardines y también vende ropa; con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos de su hogar.

Luz esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de ropa ya que se acerca la campaña navideña y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old, and the mother of two children whom she loves a lot. Because of this with great effort she managed to buy a motorbike taxi, which she rents out to to earn income to cover the household costs.  Additionally she works in the municipality of her district in the area of maintaining parks and gardens and she also sells clothing, from which she gets a bit of extra money for the household expenses.

Luz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her clothing business as the Christmas season is approaching, and in this way be able to improve her income and keep fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: to have a great business and be able to improve her quality-of-life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es: Gustavo de 63 años de edad, desde hace 30 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra. Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 63, has been cultivating the soil for 30 years.  He works hard to grow corn and beans in order to put food on the table every day.  He is known for being a hard-working, honest, responsible man who lives with his family, comprised of his wife and four children.  He and his wife work hard to support the family and given them better conditions than what they had.  Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture he has been able to maintain his household, since it is his only source of income.

With a fervent desire to get ahead, Gustavo came to the institution to request a loan for the planting season that has just begun.  He needs to begin planting as soon as possible.  He requires the loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.  He has faith in God and in his own work that he will obtain an abundant harvest in order to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo de crédito Medio Ejido, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que esta bañada por 4 ríos, cuenta con carios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro histórico aun guarda celosamente su historia, su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, laboran en diferentes actividades y aun guardan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora que se dedica al cuidado de su hogar,  pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar trabaja a diario en la venta de cosméticos de distintas marcas, este trabajo lo realiza puerta a puerta o cuando se le presenta la oportunidad, se encuentra en el negocio desde hace varios años. 
Su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de cosméticos y su nuevo crédito va a  invertir e n la compra de más cosméticos ya que se acerca la época de navidad y existe una mayor demanda. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión, solidaridad y compañerismo de todas las socias quienes luchan por un mismo objetivo el cual es salir en adelante con sus familias. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "Medio Ejido".  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that is bathed by four rivers and which has many places to enjoy nature.  Its historic center jealously preserves its history and the local people, like the members of the communal bank, struggle daily to improve their household economy.  They work in different businesses and maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

María, 33, lives with her common-law husband and their three children, ages 15, 11 and 6.  Her eldest son is in middle school and the two youngest go to the city elementary school.  Her husband is a security guard and they rent the house they live in.

María is a hard-working, determined woman who is a homemaker.  But in order to contribute to the household economy she works every day selling different brands of cosmetics.  She goes out door to door or makes a sale whenever the occasion arises, and has been in business for several years.

She used the previous loan to buy cosmetics and will use the new one to buy more products for the busy Christmas season.   She enjoys her communal bank because of the union, solidarity and comradeship of all the members who work toward the same goal of providing for their families.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Josue David

texts.es: Josue vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, él se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren  por la calidad, los precios accesibles y el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy decidido a luchar por sus sueños, está trabajando muy duro todos los días para no decepcionar a su familia, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en:
Josue lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters.  He has a milling business and processes all kinds of foods such as corn, beans, flours, sauces, etc.  He has been in business for some time and has ample experience that helps generate a good profit.  He is very well-known by the local people and has many customers who prefer his quality, low prices and unequaled customer service.  He is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and determined to fight for his dreams.

He works very hard every day so as not to disappoint his family.  He is satisfied and very comfortable in his business, and lately there has been an increase in demand for his service.  Since the two grain mills he has are not enough to keep up with production he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy a new mill.  He has good credit references and is responsible.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time and trusts he can provide his family with economy and emotional security.

loans.use: To buy a new grain mill.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte hace un año del grupo de crédito Victoria del Portete, le gusta mucho estar en el grupo por la unión y solidaridad de todas las socias al mismo tiempo que con los créditos van logrando sus objetivos personales. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia La Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar que tiene un clima frió, tiene amplias llanuras, verdes campos y una mezcla de la arquitectura moderna y antigua, su gente es a amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de 8 hijos quienes tres de ellos se encuentran en el colegio, tres en la escuela y dos son aun pequeños y pasan en casa, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María pasa al cuidado de sus hijos, como vive en el campo se dedica a la cría de  ganado  del cual vende la leche, cuyes, cerdos y gallinas, también labora en la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar y la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir para el estudio de sus hijos y también para el alimento de sus animales. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria has been part of the Victoria de Portete loan group for a year. She really likes being in the group because of the union and solidarity of all the members and at the same time because with the loans they work at achieving their personal goals. She lives in the surrounding area of the La Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca, a place which has a cold climate, large prairies, green countryside and a mixture of modern and historic architecture. The people are kind, helpful and warmhearted, and they still keep up the culture and traditions of their people.

Maria is 42 years old and the single mother of eight children of whom three are at high school, three at school, and two are at home because they are still little. She does not have her own house so she rents. 

Maria looks after the children and as she lives in the country she works raising livestock from which she sells milk, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. She also works growing crops, some of which her household consumes and some of which she sells. She is going to invest the money from her loan into the education of her children and also feed for her animals. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education costs and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Dennis Frank

texts.es:
Dennis tiene 25 años y vive en la calurosa y amable ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja como empleado en u grifo de su ciudad, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su hijo de 2 años de edad.

Dennis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda y alimentos al por mayor como arroz por saco, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y poder luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Dennis is 25 years old and lives in the warm and friendly city of Pucallpa. He works at a gas station in his city and by this generates the income to provide for his 2-year-old son.

Dennis is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided he can buy essentials for his home and wholesale food such as bags of rice, sugar, noodles, among others. By this he will improve his quality of life and be able to strive to realize his big dream: Having his own house.

loans.use: to buy essentials for his home, and food.

loans.name: Milos

texts.en:
Milos is a 27-year-old, single man who lives with his entire family in a minority community. He works as a waiter in a restaurant. Also, six months ago, he was able to save enough of his earnings to open his own gaming center for Sony PlayStation. In Kosovo, this type of business is very popular and has much demand from the younger generations. As a result, he expects much success. 

Now Milos wants to buy more gaming consoles and is in need of a loan to purchase some. His goal is to save enough money to open a larger business, which would enable him to become completely independent so he no longer needs to work at the restaurant before he gets married. He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To buy more gaming consoles.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support his labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support his labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana is 31 years old. She lives in a minority community with her husband and three children, between the ages of 4 and 11 years old. While she is a housewife, taking care of her home and children, her husband works for an electrical company. 

The income that her husband earns from his salary is barely enough for their daily expenses. This means that the annex room that they started to build a long time ago has not been finished despite attempts to save the money to do so. 

Now, for the first time, Dragana is requesting a loan in order to finish the room and facade the house in order to have a pleasant atmosphere and improve their living conditions. Her goal is to find a job in the future so that she can also contribute to their income and help give her family a better education and life. She wants to thank the lenders for this support!

loans.use: To finish the annex room that they started to build and facade the house.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus tíos en la ciudad de Nazca, el se dedica a la  venta de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el campo ferial de Nazca hace muchos años, el siempre está pendiente de ofrecerle las verduras más frescas y la mejor atención a sus clientes.
Julio Cesar, está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de Kiva, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su puesto y así ofrecer mayor variedad de verduras a sus clientes.
El sueño de Julio Cesar es tener su casa propia es por eso que día a día trabaja con mucho entusiasmo y responsabilidad para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 46 years old. He is single and lives with his aunt and uncle in the city of Nazca. He has worked selling vegetables in a stall located in the market field of Nazca for many years. He is always making sure to offer the freshest vegetables and the best service to his customers.  

Julio Cesar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since the money he invested in buying more product for his stall to offer his customers more vegetables.
Julio Cesar's dream is to have his own house. That is why today he works enthusiastically and responsibly to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa es un joven e 27 años de edad, la cual vive en la calurosa y alegre ciudad de Pucallpa, para poder sacar adelante a su pequeña de 3 años de edad, trabaja como secretaria en una institución educativa de su ciudad, desde hace algunos meses.

Rosa esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda donde habita y poder comprar enseres para su hogar y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 27 year old woman. She lives in the warm and happy city of Pucallpa. In order to get her 3 year old daughter ahead, she has worked as a secretary in an educational institution in her city for some months.

Rosa is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to do some home improvements on the house she lives in and buy equipment for her home and make her big dream come true: own her own house.

loans.use: To do home improvement and buy equipment.

loans.name: Delia Orfelina

texts.es:
La Señora Delia se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Victoria del Portete, le gusta de su grupo la unión y solidaridad de todas las socias y que con los créditos puede mejorar la economía de su hogar. Vive por el sector de Hierba Buena en Cuenca, lugar que tiene un clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes por su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de loa antiguo y lo moderno, su gente son personas amables, gentiles que lucha el día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
La Señora Delia tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de un año tres meses de edad, su esposo labora en la agricultura como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres compartiendo los gastos del hogar.
Doña Delia cuida de su pequeño hijo pero para aportar en la economía de la casa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertido en la compra de semillas para los cultivos que realiza su esposo, en pollos y  alimento para animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Delia is requesting her second loan along with her friends. She is a member of the communal bank Victoria del Portete.  What she likes about the group is the unity and solidarity among its members and that through the loans she can improve her household’s finances. She lives in the Hierba Buena area of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate and with beautiful countryside on account of the variety of its geography. Its architecture is a mix of ancient and modern. Its friendly, kind people struggle daily to improve their economic stability and thus create a better future for their children.

Delia is 20 and she lives with her husband. She has a 15-month-old son, and her husband words in agriculture as a day-labourer. They don’t have their own house, so they live with her parents and share the household expenses. Delia looks after her small son, but in order to contribute to the household expenses she works at raising pigs and chickens. She is going to invest the loan in buying seed for her husband’s crops and in chickens and food for the animals. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chickens and animal food.

loans.name: Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cumbe está conformado por 9 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una exuberante vegetación, de un clima frió, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosecha una gran variedad de hortalizas, también crían animales en especial ganado, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo o lo moderno. Las socias son personas amables y gentiles que trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y ser independientes económicamente.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Lisandra, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Cumbe, espera poder sumar a este hermoso grupo y aportar con su corta experiencia y aprender de todas sus compañeras para salir adelante en la vida.
La Señora. Lisandra es una mujer muy joven que se encuentra viviendo en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros en donde comparten los gastos del hogar.
Doña Lisandra hace poco tiempo inicio con su propio negocio el cual es una papelería en la que está trabajando de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para  el consumo su casa, también  cría pollos los que vende en pie o pelados. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cuadernos, lápices, reglas y más útiles escolares para su papelería. Su meta es tener una papelería más grande.
texts.en:
The Cumbe credit group is made up of 9 women who live around the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. It is a place known for its exuberant vegetation, its cold climate, and its fertile soil where a large variety of vegetables are grown. They also raise animals, especially cattle. Its architecture is a mixture of old and new. The members are kind and gentle people who work daily in different activities which allow them to cover their household expenses and be financially independent. 

One of the members of the group is Lisandra. She is taking out her first loan with her friends and companions in the Cumbe credit group. She hopes to be able to be a part of this beautiful group and contribute her brief experience and learn from all of the other members to get ahead in life. Lisandra is a very young woman who is living in a common law marriage and has a 2 year old son. Her husband is a driver by trade and he drives a truck. They don't have their own house and they live with her parents-in-law, where they share the household expenses. 

A short time ago, Lisandra started her own business, which is a paper goods store. She works there Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule. She also works in agriculture for household consumption. She raises chickens that she sells alive or butchered.  She is going to invest her loan in buying notebooks, pencils, gifts, and more school supplies for her paper goods store. Her goal is to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, rulers and more school supplies.

loans.name: Trinidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Trinidad está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este lugar goza de mucha vegetación y verdes prados, es conocida como el mirador de la ciudad ya que desde lo más alto se puede admirar la belleza de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente es amable, gentil como las socias quienes son unas guerreras ya que siempre se encuentran en la lucha de mejorar su estabilidad económica y a la vez sacar adelante a sus familias, su orgullo es de mantener su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres que un día les inculcaron.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Carmen, se encuentra en el banco comunal Trinidad desde hace 5 años, tiempo en el que los créditos le han ayudado para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a su familia, también por la cordialidad de sus amigas.
La Señora María Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 17, 15 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda   económicamente, tres están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia construida con el sacrificio de los dos.
Doña María Carmen pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa en donde se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, labora en la dura tarea del campo como es la agricultura y sus cosechas las vende y también utiliza para el consumo de su hogar, también cría pollos, cuyes y borregos, los fines de semana trabaja en el arreglo de casas. 
El dinero de su crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, cuyes, borregos y  alimento para animales. Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta acabados y que sus hijos algún día lleguen a ser  profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Trinidad" communal bank is made up of seven members who live around the Turi parish in Cuenca.  This place is lush with vegetation and green meadows.  It is known as the city viewpoint as, from its highest point, you can admire the beauty of the city of Cuenca.  The people here in Turi are friendly and courteous, much like the members of the communal bank - they are also fighters, always working to improve financial stability in their lives and also help their families to prosper.  The people of Turi are proud to keep up the culture and traditions that they were taught by their parents.

One member of this group is María Carmen, who has been with the communal bank for five years.  During this time, loans have helped her to improve her financial stability and to get ahead with her family.

María Carmen is 37 years old.  She is married and, with her husband, has four children - aged 19, 17, 15, and 12 years old respectively.  The eldest is working and supports the household financially.  The other three children are studying at one of the schools in the city.  María Carmen's husband works as a builder.  The couple owns the house they live in; they built it with a lot of sacrifice.

María Carmen spends most of her time at home, where she does household chores.  She also works hard in the field as a farmer: she uses part of her harvest to feed her family, and the rest she sells.  In addition María Carmen raises chickens, guinea pigs, and lambs.  At the weekend, she works fixing houses.

This loan will be invested in buying chickens, guinea pigs, lambs, and in feed for the animals.  María Carmen's goal is to finish her house as there are still a couple of small things to do.  Her other goal is for her children to become professionals.

The small photo in the image is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, lambs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Gabriel Arcangel

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Nazca. Es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque es padre de un niño de 1 año de edad al cual quiere mucho y por ello trabaja muy duro como chofer de taxi, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar una pequeña combi, con la cual hace colectivos entre distritos lo cual le permite tener un ingreso mas para poder solventar a su familia.

Gabriel esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá apoyar a su esposa en su pequeño negocio de venta de quesos, ya que comprara javas y queso al por mayor con lo cual su esposa podrá trabajar y poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 30 years old and lives in the hot city of Nazca.  He is very hard-working, particularly because he is a father to a one-year-old boy, whom he loves very much and for whom her works very hard as a taxi driver.  In addition, with a lot of effort, Gabriel managed to buy a small minibus with which he runs routes between districts - this gives him an additional income in order to support the family.

Gabriel is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support being provided, he will be able to support his wife with her small business selling cheeses.  With the loan, he will buy crates and cheese in bulk.  These items will allow Gabriel's wife to work and to improve her income and quality of life.  She can then continue fighting to make her dream, of owning her own house, a reality.

loans.use: to buy cheese, crates, and more.

loans.name: Luisa Antonia

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona y para poder salir adelante trabaja como empleada de limpieza en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, Luisa labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va nien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Luisa agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar ladrillos para poder terminar de construir una habitación para su madre, de esta podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad  su gran sueño “Tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Luisa is 41 years old and lives in the Parcona district.  In order to get ahead Luisa works as a cleaner for a small business in the city.  Luisa works some ten hours per day and thinks it is going well because she is very responsible. 

Luisa is grateful for the support being provided by Kiva lenders as, thanks to this help, she will be able to buy bricks in order to finish building a room for her mother.  With the room Luisa can improve her quality of life and continue fighting to make her dream, of having a restaurant, a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a lady of twenty-seven years. She is a single mother of two children, she sells second-hand shoes in Kangemi and has been in this business for seven years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.


This will be Margaret's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new stock of shoes. In future she wants to educate her children and also open a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 39. He has four children, and they go to school. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Besarte

texts.en: Besarte lives in the southern part of Kosovo, is 26 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 4 years old and 2 months old. Her husband works as a construction worker and she is a housewife taking care of the home and their children, in addition to working in agriculture based on family tradition. Besarte keeps goats that she uses for her family’s needs and also sells the products in her area for extra income since her husband’s salary is not enough. Besarte is asking for a loan to buy food for the goats so that she can increase her income and double the amount she can sell. Her goal is to expand her farm and add more animals so that she can provide a better education and life for her children. Besarte would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy food for her goats

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is from the small village of Oktomberi. He is 23 years old and married. He lives with his wife and sister. Nick and his sister get small refugee pensions from the local government as they are internally displaced persons. Nick’s wife is a hair stylist and earns a monthly income. Nick leads the family agricultural business and is raising two cows, four calves and a pig. Besides that, he grows nuts in his garden and sells his harvest seasonally. Nick has a grain mill as well and serves locals in return for a service fee. 

In order to improve family income, Nick plans to start a store in his house and applied for this credit.  With the received amount, Nick will purchase flour, bran and sugar at wholesale prices and resell them for a profit. He will work as a salesperson himself and earn additional money. The increased profits will be reinvested in the little store to increase his stock and volume of sales. As a result of the loan, Nick's family members will be able to meet their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and bran for resale

loans.name: Miradije

texts.en:
Miradije is 42 years old and a mother of six children between the ages of 6 and 17 years old, with five of them currently attending school. Miradije is a housewife and her husband receives a pension which is not enough money to provide for a large family. Although they live in a new home that was built for them by a humanitarian organization in the Roma community, they are still having difficulties providing for all of their food and expenses. 

With the upcoming winter season, costs to heat the house will increase as they will need to be purchasing large quantities of wood. General electric costs are charged at a higher rate. Anticipating this, Miradije is requesting a loan in order purchase the wood so that she will not have to worry about keeping her family warm and healthy during the cold. Her goal is to find a job and offer her children a better life and education. She wants to thank all the lenders for improving conditions for her family!

loans.use: To purchase the wood to keep her family warm and healthy

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 63 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lutafete

texts.en:
Lutafete is 37 years old, married and a mother of three children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old.  For more than five years now, Lutafete has been working together with her husband managing their own printing business, where they print different materials like leaflets, brochures, and calendars for various companies and clients. They operate from the southern part of Kosovo where they live together with their children and their business has been going well due to all of the effort and hard work that they put into it.  

Although they have a lot of competition in this business, the quality of their work is of a higher level, which allows them to have a lot of clients. Now, for the first time Lutafete is requesting a loan in order to by raw materials such as paper which will improve their income from their business. She is hoping in the future to expand her business even more and open their market up to serve all of Kosovo. She is hoping to give her children a better education with this opportunity and business and appreciates this help.

loans.use: To by raw materials such as paper for her printing business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Emma from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Emma is married with 3 children between 7 and 21. Her children are currently attending school and living at home. She runs a table business selling charcoal, 'eddoes', bananas, etc.  She describes herself as a serious business woman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her mother.  Typically, she works  7 am to 4 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as not enough working capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase charcoal, 'eddoes', bananas, etc.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advanced for your support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, 'eddoes' (fruit), bananas, etc.

loans.name: Las Vecinas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Vecinas está formado por 10 mujeres que día a día buscan  mejorar la economía de sus hogares, eso lo logran día a día con el duro trabajo en sus trabajos o negocios, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico fue nombrado como Patrimonio de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía es muy variada.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora presentación, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y vecinas del grupo de crédito Las Vecinas, su aspiración es de poder crecer en los proyectos que esta por realizar para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
La Señora Presentación tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Ella trabaja desde hace 5 años como obrera en una fábrica de lunes a viernes 8 horas al día. 
El dinero de su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para iniciar con este negocio y espera que todo salga como lo a planificado. Su meta es tener un local de venta de artesanías y de ropa.
texts.en:
The “Las Vecinas“[The Neighbors] group is comprised of ten members who strive daily to improve their household economies. They achieve this goal by working hard every day in their jobs or businesses, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.  They live in Cuenca, a city with a cold climate that is bathed by four rivers.  Its historical center was named “Patrimonio de la Humanidad” [World Heritage Site] thanks to its beautiful architecture and varied gastronomy.

One of the group members is Presentación, who is requesting her first loan alongside her friends and neighbors in the “Las Vecinas” communal bank.  Her aspiration is to be able to expand the projects she is working on and offer her children a better future.  

Presentación is 27 years old and a single mother of a two year old child.  She doesn’t own her own home and so, lives in a rented dwelling.  She has been a factory worker for five years, and works eight hours a day, Monday through Friday.  She will invest the funds from her first loan in the purchase of clothing to begin this business and expects everything to go as planned.  Her goal is to have a business location, and sell handicrafts and clothing

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un mejor desarrollo y una cosecha mejor en los próximos años y con el ingreso mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 48 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. With his loan he intends to buy fertilizers and fungicides and pay for manual labour to help with the work involved in coffee growing, taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil and climatic and other conditions which are favourable for growing coffee. 

With these improvements to his cultivation Gerardo hopes the crop will develop better and produce a better harvest in the coming years. With the income he hopes to improve his family's living conditions and also invest a little more in the cultivation and achieve some of his goals.

This is the first loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans previously from State banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to pay for workers to help with growing coffee.

loans.name: Driton

texts.en:
Driton is 28 years old, single, and lives with his entire family in the southern part of Kosovo. He is very hard-working, and he wants to help his parents to have better living conditions since his parents don’t work and his father receives a pension as his income. 

Although Driton currently works as a guard, he generates a low salary and his income is not enough to complete the long needed renovations on his home. He needs to repair the roof especially now in this season when the snow and rain are expected. Since the roof is not properly completed, it leaks whenever it rains and allows the wind to enter. 

Driton is requesting a loan for the first time in order to fix the roof. This loan will help him be able to have the necessary repairs before the winter to ensure that his family is kept dry, safe, and warm. Driton hopes to find a better paying job in the future and he is hoping to get married and have children. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To fix the roof of his house

loans.name: Fixherije

texts.en:
Fixherije is a 39-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 7 and 14. They live in the southern part of Kosovo. She has been operating a handicraft business for more than 10 years. Her husband works in construction for a private company and earns a very low salary. Often she has orders for weddings, special events, and casual wear for her local customers. She is very keen in her job and loves work very much. 

She is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy material for her work since she has a lot of orders and has used up all of the material she currently has. So far, she has been sustaining her business through all of her hard work and dedication. She hopes to increase her income and to expand her business in the future so that she can have her own shop. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all lenders!

loans.use: To buy material for her handicraft work

loans.name: Armida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Armida, tuvo efectos positivos en su negocio con el crédito que se le dio antes, pues ella pudo estabilizarse económicamente, pago sus cuotas. Con la inversión ella comprara chicharrón, aceite, pastas, arroz, quesillo, etc., y variedad de bebidas. Con esto tendrá un inventario que le permitirá trabajar sin ningún problema por un tiempo, generar los ingresos necesarios para pagar la nueva duda, tendrá más productos para satisfacer a sus clientes.
La familia se mantiene unida, con el mismo número de miembros, están muy saludables y siguen brindándole el apoyo en el negocio para brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en: Armida had positive effects on her business with the credit that was given before because she was able to achieve financial stability and pay her debts.  With this investment, she will purchase pork, oil, pasta, rice, cheese, and a variety of drinks. This inventory will allow her to work without any problems for a while, generate the income she needs to pay the new debt, and have more products to satisfy her customers.  Her family remains united, with the same number of members.  They are very healthy and continue offering support in the business and providing good service..

loans.use: to purchase pork, oil, pasta, rice, cheese, and a variety of drinks

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, surtirá la tienda con más productos de primera necesidad, comprara golosinas, aceite, arroz, maíz, bebidas y otros. El préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, satisfacer a sus clientes y ha podido salir de sus deudas con responsabilidad. El negocio no le ha dado ningún problema que le evite seguir realizando dicha actividad.
Sigue luchando por ampliar cada día más su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos estable y tener los recursos necesarios para brindar a su familia mejor alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Inés will stock her shop with more everyday essentials. She plans to buy sweets, oil, rice, corn, drinks and other items. The previous loan gave her the chance to expand her business and satisfy her customers and she has been able to pay off her debts responsibly. 

Inés has not had any problems with the business which could prevent her from continuing with it. She continues to strive to increase her business all the time so she can have a stable source of income and have enough money to provide her family with better food and health.

loans.use: to buy sweets, oil, rice, corn, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Carolina Suleyma

texts.es:
Carolina, está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Hace un tiempo empezó a poner en práctica el oficio que aprendió de su madre y estableció una venta de tortillas; atiende a sus clientes de 7:00 a.m. hasta 7:00 p.m.; con el fin de apoyar en los gastos de la casa, no representa una actividad difícil de ejercer y puede estar pendiente de su familia.
Comprará maíz y leña, para tener la materia prima necesaria que le permitirán trabajar, generar ingresos que necesita para  poder ir pagando la deuda y apoyar a su familia.
Carolina sueña con trabajar mucho y ahorrar para montar un chalet, vender tortillas y ofrecer otro tipo de producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina lives with her life partner and her son. Some time ago she decided to put into practice the skills which she learnt from her mother and started selling tortillas. She serves her customers from 7am until 7pm with the aim of helping towards the household expenses. It is not difficult work and she can look after her family at the same time.

Carolina will buy corn and firewood to have the raw materials she needs for her work and this will generate income which she needs to pay off the loan and support her family. She dreams of working hard and saving to buy a stall to sell tortillas and other products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. Hhe needs fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he hopes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and support labor costs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es viuda, vive con 4 hijos y 5 nietos, desde que su esposo murió es ella la encargada de generar los ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos y siembra de granos básicos. Estas actividades son apoyadas por sus hijos los cuales dependen de ella. La experiencia que posee le ha permitido saber administrar el negocio y evitar alguna clase problema que le genere perdidas.
Comprará una vaca, dos cerdos e insumos agrícolas para postrera, con los cuales fortalecerá el negocio y podrá aumentar la comercialización de productos lácteos, también generara ingresos para cancelar la deuda y no quedar con mal record crediticio. 
Aspira a sacarle el mayor provechó al crédito para seguir ampliando el negocio y darle a su familia mejor alimentación, salud, y educación. También forjar un patrimonio para sus nietos.
texts.en:
María is a widow and lives with 4 children and 5 grandchildren. Since her husband died she has had the responsibility for generating income to bring up her family. She raises cattle and pigs and also grows basic grains. In these activities she is helped by her children who are dependent on her. The experience she has means she has been able to manage the business and avoid any potential problems which could lead to losses.

María will buy a cow, two pigs and agricultural supplies for the second crop. With these she will be able to strengthen her business and increase her sales of dairy products. She will also generate income to pay off the loan so she does not have a bad credit record. She hopes to get maximum benefit from the loan so she can continue to increase her business and give her family better food, health and education. She also wants to build up assets for her grandchildren.

loans.use: Comprará una vaca, dos cerdos e insumos agrícolas para postrera.

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina, age 47, is a nurse. She and her husband, who works at a local post office, live in a village in a minority community. They have one son. 

The family's home is in a tiny, cramped, and crumbling house, so they gathered their resources and started to build a new house. The structure of the new house is finished, but their incomes do not provide enough money to complete the construction.

Jasmina has decided to request her first loan so that she will be able to finish construction of her new home. Her goal is to provide better living conditions and security for her family. 

She intends to save enough money to secure the family's future. 

She appreciates the help of all her lenders!

loans.use: to finish construction of the family home so that she can provide better living conditions and security for her family

loans.name: Jelena

texts.en:
Jelena is 41 years old and the married mother of three children, two girls and one boy, ages 15 to 20 years old. She is a housewife, receiving a social pension, and her husband works in a clinic as a support technician, earning a low salary. They all live in a minority community. 

Her house needs immediate renovations. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm. 

Jelena is applying for a loan of EUR 1,500 to buy materials to renovate her home’s roof, which has needed repairs for a long time. The damage to the roof is so much that when it is snowing and raining, the water leaks into the home, causing additional damage, drafts, and poor living conditions. 

As winter is approaching, she would like to get the roof repaired quickly so that she can keep everyone in the family warm, safe, and healthy. 

Jelena hopes in the future to find a job and to offer better living conditions for her family. She is very thankful for all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials to renovate her home’s roof

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe, age 36, is a farmer. She has been engaged in this work for the past 16 years. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production on her farm. Buying fertilizer will allow her to increase her production. With the anticipated profits from her farming efforts, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a man of 61 years, married to Martha and together they have three children. 

He sells clothes in Limuru and also jackets. He has been in this business for four years and gets a monthly income of 70,000 shillings.

This will be Joseph's second loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy new clothes. He wants to own a bigger shop in future and also educate his children.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maimash

texts.en:
Maimash, 32, operates a shop selling rice, oil, salt, vita, pepper, etc. in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

She is married and has four children between 2 and 10. Three are currently attending school and they all live at home. She did not go to school but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as good business woman.

She has had this business for the past three years now. She started her business with help from her husband. She likes her business because it helps her buy some items for her home. She works 12 hours, six days a week at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is during the rainy season when she hardly gets customers. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, oil, salt, vita, pepper etc. In the future, she wants to own a house.  

She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, salt, vita, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Slavica

texts.en:
Slavica is 30 years old and the mother of two children, ages 4 and 6 years old.  She lives in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband works as a guard for a private company.

Based on tradition, Slavica is involved in agriculture, earning money by working on her and her neighbor's land. She is a very hard worker and plants vegetables, corn, and wheat to harvest for her family's dietary needs, to sell for income, and to earn a fee harvesting and working her neighbor’s crops. 

Slavica enjoys her work and is satisfied with what she does to help her family. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy tools and machinery to continue to plow and harvest the land. The loan will help her to work more effectively and efficiently, thereby generating more income to provide a better life for her family. 

She is very grateful to KIVA lenders for the financial support given to help her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and machinery for plowing and harvesting the land

loans.name: Venant

texts.en:
Venant is 71 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his harvest.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 58 years old. He is a father of three children. 

Jean is a farmer. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred has a retail shop in Tala town. She also sells cereals. She has been in the business for three years. She is 60 years old and widowed with two children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of flour, soft drinks, maize and beans. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to expand it by buying more stock of goods to sell.

This is her second loan and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Winfred's hope for the future is to open another retail shop.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is 33 years old, recently married and she is expecting twins soon. She and her husband live in the southern part of Kosovo, where her husband works in construction and Lindita works sometimes making handicrafts when she has an order. They live in an old house that has not had a renovation for a long time and is in dire need of repairs to the roof.  

Up until now, her husband’s salary and her additional income has not been enough to address this problem since their combined income is very low. She is now requesting a loan to complete the repairs before her babies are born so that she can create better living conditions for her new family and keep everyone healthy and warm. She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the help!

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Sladana

texts.en:
Sladana is 47 years old and married.  She has a son who is also married, all living together in a minority community. Sonja's husband receives a pension while she works in a clinic as providing technical assistance, and her son earns a low salary as a teacher. 

Although they were able to build a new home to all live together, combined their income is not enough to finish the two rooms on the second floor of her house that will be for her son and his family. 

Sladana is asking for a loan through KosInvest to purchase the materials needed and pay for the workers. She believes that this loan will help her family to have better living conditions and allow for her son to live more privately to start his own family as she hopes to soon have grandchildren. 

Knowing that is Kiva loan she wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials needed to complete two rooms on her second floor for her married son

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 48 years old and operates a business selling goods such as lappa (fabric) from a table at a market in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. The area is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. It boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

She is a widow with four children ages 15 to 30; only one child lives at home and is in school. For the past four years, she has been selling lappa in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days in a week, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., and most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is 37 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is aged 46 years old. He is maize farmer -- both he and his wife have been for the past 20 years. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kujtesa

texts.en:
